story:
The Indie Game Riot is a weekly podcast hosted by three people with a passion for indie games and the community that surrounds them. Our show seeks to accomplish these goals every week:
  • Support indie games and their developers by "Starting a Riot" to garner attention for them through our show.
  • Strengthen the community around indie games by enabling discussion, camaraderie, and support between developers and gamers alike.
  • "Enable the Evolution" that indie gaming has already started within the video game industry.
  • Entertain the hell out of the ears of anyone that wants to listen!
This campaign was created in order to improve the show and allow us to better attain the goals stated above. Indie game developers injected passion back into the gaming industry. They are creating extremely innovative games that are usually very affordable (sometimes free!) and without the constraints of large corporations, have created a spark in the industry using their own imaginations and personalities that have inspired millions of people around the world, including us. We want to return the favor by giving developers as much support as possible and doing our part to strengthen the community that has bonded around their games.

Here are what some listeners, as well as developers, have had to say about Indie Game Riot!

 (Makers of "Papo & Yo"): Thank you for that beautiful and meaningful talk you had about Papo & Yo on your show!
Tony Y: Please never stop posting. This podcast is one of my favorite ways to catch up on my fellow indie devs.
"Ilehsadam" (Mod of Reddit.com/r/IndieGaming): A lot of podcasters don't have a good flow going. You guys are great. You could probably talk about door knobs and I'd listen.

Anthony P: I'm officially addicted to this podcast. The production quality put into this goes a really long way and every recommendation so far has been a great discovery. Lovin' this stuff, so keep it up!
"Inevpatoria": I’ve really grown to like the Indie Game Riot crew, their podcasts, and their streams. Reverend, Tekedo, and JaShinYa are three really good guys with a lot of passion for this burgeoning community. They approach indie games with care and enthusiasm. And they dedicate a staggering toll of effort to inform their listeners about the really cool things going on and the cool people making it all happen. Whether that means interviewing people just trying to get games off the ground, or by getting you connected to major events throughout the industry.

For an example of what we do and how our show is in its current state, check out our most recent episode:


The Hosts:

 JaShinYa: JaShinYa (Josh Musser) is the creator of "Indie Game Riot!", professional voice actor, as well as a Let's Player on Youtube. He creates videos of an eclectic assortment of games and hosts the podcast episodes on his channel. Indie games became a passion as he discovered more and more creativity and ingenuity within the community while also empathizing with the developers who work extremely hard to put their works of art into the public's hands. He lives in Pennsylvania with his wife, 2 year old daughter and a mystery baby living inside of his wife.
Contact JaShinYa:
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/JaShinYaGaming
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JaShinYa
Twitter: https://twitter.com/JaShinYa

What Indie Game Riot means to Josh:

Tekedo: Tekedo (Dillion Schmidt) Is an award winning editor and film maker from eastern US. When not behind a camera or editing a film, Tek loves sitting back and playing video games. His Youtube channel, showcases his escapades in Planetside 2, as well as other titles that include incredible indie games. He is a video game lover and is always excited for the next independent release. Whether it be on Youtube or in his free time, there is never a moment that isn't a good time for a great game.
Contact Tekedo:
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/TekedoPlays
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TekedoPlays
Twitter: https://twitter.com/tekedo_

Why the indie game community is important to Tek:

 Reverend: Reverend (Bryan) is a professional IT guy. With a focus on systems administration and networking, he's worked with some pretty big names in the IT sphere. Despite being extremely active in other gaming hobbies (LARPing, tabletop games, etc.), he loves to kick back and spend some time going murder-hobo in various games. Lately though, he's becoming more and more disillusioned by the AAA scene andhas found himself more interested in the Independent Developer's scene.
Contact Reverend:
Youtube https://www.youtube.com/DSReverend 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/ReverendDS  

What the indie game community and Indie Game Riot mean to Rev:


We need funding to move the show past the good level to GREAT. With a better, enhanced version of The Indie Game Riot, we will draw in new people to watch or listen to the show which will allow us to garner more attention for the games we feature. Below is an approximate breakdown of where the money will go:


More specifically, we will need: 
  • A website designed with back end capability that allows us to edit as needed.
  • A domain and hosting capable of giving us plenty of storage and bandwidth.
  • Professional motion graphics for the segment bumpers and possibly the intro and splash screen.
  • A similar, but upgraded logo design to give us a better presence online.
  • Better audio equipment (Mics, mixers, etc...). The better quality we have, the more people will stop and listen to what we have to say.
  • PC upgrades. In order for us to not only test out games that may potentially deserve a feature on the show, a better PC means more editing power.

Here are some of the things you get when you contribute!

  

  

   

   

  

  

 




If we exceed our goals, we definitely have plans for the additional funding:




On the other hand, if do not meet our goal, we will still be able to use whatever funding was given to us. Our needs are prioritized as such:
  1. IndieGoGo/Paypal Fees and Perks (Note that IndieGoGo will take 9% as opposed to 4% if we do not meet the goal)
  2. Website Design and Domain/Hosting
  3. Updated and Professional Graphics
  4. Equipment Upgrades
  5. Stretch Goals


    If you are here, we can only assume that you love indie games as much as we do. The show's goal from the very beginning was to support the indie game community as much as we possibly can. With your help, we can do so much more!

    For you, the backer, this means spreading the news about indie games you may have missed. If it weren't for the fact that you and many others, discovered them through us and supported them by playing their games, they may have been otherwise discouraged or financially unable to continue doing great work. For instance, imagine an indie gaming world where Castle Crashers has failed and subsequent games like BattleBlock Theater never came into fruition.

    Not to mention how aspiring developers, who may have the next incredible indie game concept, may not have the resources to get the game started or have the ability to get the word out to more than their friends and family. With a better Indie Game Riot, we can not only tell everyone about their project, but improve their lack of resources through crowd funding, sales of the game, helping them network within the industry or even eventually helping through our "Enable The Evolution Scholarship" program!



    Through our show, we have been able to connect various indie developers with ways to connect with other professionals within the community. Aspiring devs have thanked us for reporting on game jams and indie gaming conventions that they otherwise would not have known about where they were not only able to showoff their work, but also connect with others involved with making games.

    Also, The Indie Game Riot has helped several developers push attention and sales of their games. We even helped a Kickstarter go past the tipping point of reaching their goal at the last minute!

    Lastly, many fans of the show have expressed their thanks for showing them games they've enjoyed playing, but would have never known about if it wasn't for IGR!

    Basically, what we're saying is that we must be doing something right to be hearing about all of this and we hope that you all are willing to trust us to continue this while constantly trying to do even more for the community we love!


    The nice thing about this campaign is that there really isn't much risk. Whether we don't achieve our goal or exceed it, there is always a place for the money to go that will improve the show in some way.

    As for the challenges that we face, the majority of it comes from dealing with freelance website designers, hosting companies, motion graphic designers, etc... There is a level of uncertainty that comes with working with people you don't know and therefore there's a chance we will not be happy with the work or the prices given to us may be higher than originally anticipated. While these issues aren't game breakers, it may slow down the progress on our plans.

    Throughout this campaign and after, we plan on updating you with progress reports on the show, how the money is being spent and any immediate effects the improvements may have produced. This way, you always know what's going on with us and the money you gave.


    We absolutely understand that not everyone can help out financially, but that's OK! One of the best ways you can help out is by sharing this campaign with everyone you know (and strangers too, if you're willing)! It only takes a minute, so please take the time to "Start The Riot" by sharing this link anywhere and everywhere. IndieGoGo even has some nifty share tools you can use!

    Other than that, you and all your people can keep updated on the progress and of course, with the show itself with these various social networks and links:

    • Facebook
    • Twitter
    • Youtube
    • Reddit
    • Hitbox.tv
    • Our Website

    Thanks so much for your help! Feel free to contact us at any time and remember to "Enable The Evolution"!

    -The Indie Game Riot hosts,

    Josh, Tek & Rev
story_txt:
The Indie Game Riot is a weekly podcast hosted by three people with a passion for indie games and the community that surrounds them. Our show seeks to accomplish these goals every week:


Support indie games and their developers by "Starting a Riot" to garner attention for them through our show.
Strengthen the community around indie games by enabling discussion, camaraderie, and support between developers and gamers alike.
"Enable the Evolution" that indie gaming has already started within the video game industry.
Entertain the hell out of the ears of anyone that wants to listen!
This campaign was created in order to improve the show and allow us to better attain the goals stated above. Indie game developers injected passion back into the gaming industry. They are creating extremely innovative games that are usually very affordable (sometimes free!) and without the constraints of large corporations, have created a spark in the industry using their own imaginations and personalities that have inspired millions of people around the world, including us. We want to return the favor by giving developers as much support as possible and doing our part to strengthen the community that has bonded around their games.


Here are what some listeners, as well as developers, have had to say about Indie Game Riot!



 (Makers of "Papo & Yo"): Thank you for that beautiful and meaningful talk you had about Papo & Yo on your show!


Tony Y: Please never stop posting. This podcast is one of my favorite ways to catch up on my fellow indie devs.


"Ilehsadam" (Mod of Reddit.com/r/IndieGaming): A lot of podcasters don't have a good flow going. You guys are great. You could probably talk about door knobs and I'd listen.




Anthony P: I'm officially addicted to this podcast. The production quality put into this goes a really long way and every recommendation so far has been a great discovery. Lovin' this stuff, so keep it up!
"Inevpatoria": I’ve really grown to like the Indie Game Riot crew, their podcasts, and their streams. Reverend, Tekedo, and JaShinYa are three really good guys with a lot of passion for this burgeoning community. They approach indie games with care and enthusiasm. And they dedicate a staggering toll of effort to inform their listeners about the really cool things going on and the cool people making it all happen. Whether that means interviewing people just trying to get games off the ground, or by getting you connected to major events throughout the industry.

For an example of what we do and how our show is in its current state, check out our most recent episode:






The Hosts:

 JaShinYa: JaShinYa (Josh Musser) is the creator of "Indie Game Riot!", 

professional voice actor, as well as a Let's Player on Youtube. He creates videos of an 
eclectic assortment of games and hosts the podcast episodes on his channel. Indie 
games became a passion as he discovered more and more creativity and ingenuity 
within the community while also empathizing with the developers who work extremely 
hard to put their works of art into the public's hands. He lives in Pennsylvania with his 
wife, 2 year old daughter and a mystery baby living inside of his wife.Contact JaShinYa:Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/JaShinYaGamingFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/JaShinYaTwitter: https://twitter.com/JaShinYa

What Indie Game Riot means to Josh:





Tekedo: Tekedo (Dillion Schmidt) Is an award winning editor and film maker from eastern US. When not behind a camera or editing a film, Tek loves sitting back and playing video games. His Youtube channel, showcases his escapades in Planetside 2, as well as other titles that include incredible indie games. He is a video game lover and is 
always excited for the next independent release. Whether it be on Youtube or in his free 
time, there is never a moment that isn't a good time for a great game.Contact Tekedo:Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/TekedoPlaysFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/TekedoPlaysTwitter: https://twitter.com/tekedo_

Why the indie game community is important to Tek:




 Reverend: Reverend (Bryan) is a professional IT guy. With a focus on 
systems administration and networking, he's worked with some pretty big names in the 
IT sphere. Despite being extremely active in other gaming hobbies (LARPing, tabletop 
games, etc.), he loves to kick back and spend some time going murder-hobo in various 
games. Lately though, he's becoming more and more disillusioned by the AAA scene andhas found himself more interested in the Independent Developer's scene.Contact Reverend:Youtube https://www.youtube.com/DSReverend Twitter: https://twitter.com/ReverendDS
 
What the indie game community and Indie Game Riot mean to Rev:




We need funding to move the show past the good level to GREAT. With a better, enhanced version of The Indie Game Riot, we will draw in new people to watch or listen to the show which will allow us to garner more attention for the games we feature. Below is an approximate breakdown of where the money will go:



More specifically, we will need: 



A website designed with back end capability that allows us to edit as needed.

A domain and hosting capable of giving us plenty of storage and bandwidth.
Professional motion graphics for the segment bumpers and possibly the intro and splash screen.
A similar, but upgraded logo design to give us a better presence online.
Better audio equipment (Mics, mixers, etc...). The better quality we have, the more people will stop and listen to what we have to say.
PC upgrades. In order for us to not only test out games that may potentially deserve a feature on the show, a better PC means more editing power.



Here are some of the things you get when you contribute!



  
  
   
   
  
  
 







If we exceed our goals, we definitely have plans for the additional funding:










On the other hand, if do not meet our goal, we will still be able to use whatever funding was given to us. Our needs are prioritized as such:

IndieGoGo/Paypal Fees and Perks (Note that IndieGoGo will take 9% as opposed to 4% if we do not meet the goal)
Website Design and Domain/Hosting
Updated and Professional Graphics
Equipment Upgrades
Stretch Goals


  

If you are here, we can only assume that you love indie games as much as we do. The show's goal from the very beginning was to support the indie game community as much as we possibly can. With your help, we can do so much more!
For you, the backer, this means spreading the news about indie games you may have missed. If it weren't for the fact that you and many others, discovered them through us and supported them by playing their games, they may have been otherwise discouraged or financially unable to continue doing great work. For instance, imagine an indie gaming world where Castle Crashers has failed and subsequent games like BattleBlock Theater never came into fruition.
Not to mention how aspiring developers, who may have the next incredible indie game concept, may not have the resources to get the game started or have the ability to get the word out to more than their friends and family. With a better Indie Game Riot, we can not only tell everyone about their project, but improve their lack of resources through crowd funding, sales of the game, helping them network within the industry or even eventually helping through our "Enable The Evolution Scholarship" program!




Through our show, we have been able to connect various indie developers with ways to connect with other professionals within the community. Aspiring devs have thanked us for reporting on game jams and indie gaming conventions that they otherwise would not have known about where they were not only able to showoff their work, but also connect with others involved with making games.
Also, The Indie Game Riot has helped several developers push attention and sales of their games. We even helped a Kickstarter go past the tipping point of reaching their goal at the last minute!
Lastly, many fans of the show have expressed their thanks for showing them games they've enjoyed playing, but would have never known about if it wasn't for IGR!
Basically, what we're saying is that we must be doing something right to be hearing about all of this and we hope that you all are willing to trust us to continue this while constantly trying to do even more for the community we love!



The nice thing about this campaign is that there really isn't much risk. Whether we don't achieve our goal or exceed it, there is always a place for the money to go that will improve the show in some way.
As for the challenges that we face, the majority of it comes from dealing with freelance website designers, hosting companies, motion graphic designers, etc... There is a level of uncertainty that comes with working with people you don't know and therefore there's a chance we will not be happy with the work or the prices given to us may be higher than originally anticipated. While these issues aren't game breakers, it may slow down the progress on our plans.
Throughout this campaign and after, we plan on updating you with progress reports on the show, how the money is being spent and any immediate effects the improvements may have produced. This way, you always know what's going on with us and the money you gave.


We absolutely understand that not everyone can help out financially, but that's OK! One of the best ways you can help out is by sharing this campaign with everyone you know (and strangers too, if you're willing)! It only takes a minute, so please take the time to "Start The Riot" by sharing this link anywhere and everywhere. IndieGoGo even has some nifty share tools you can use!Other than that, you and all your people can keep updated on the progress and of course, with the show itself with these various social networks and links:


Facebook
Twitter
Youtube
Reddit
Hitbox.tv
Our Website

Thanks so much for your help! Feel free to contact us at any time and remember to "Enable The Evolution"!
-The Indie Game Riot hosts,
Josh, Tek & Rev

story:
Update - We Are Filled with Cosmic Awe

Thank you very much! We hit our tertiary target with three days to go. Any extra funds we'll use to add features to the generator.

What We Are Offering

Trail of Cthulhu is an award-winning table top roleplaying game where you play an Investigator exploring HP Lovecraft's brain-searing Cthulhu Mythos. The Trail of Cthulhu Character Builder will be a simple, slick online utlity. It creates these investigators, then exports them as PDFs, using the Trail of Cthulhu character sheet. You can even share these PDFs with other Trail of Cthulhu players.

As we exceed out target we'll include support for other games, including

Who Will Benefit

All Trail of Cthulhu roleplayers will benefit from this free utility, which we'll host on the Pelgrane Press website. To make this happen, we'd like to compensate our programmer Graham Walmsley for the many hours he has, and will, put into the creation of this utility, and ensure it's maintained for a long time.

Please Tell your Friends

Please tweet about us with a hashtag #TrailChargen, post on table-top game forums and on your blog.

story:
The Game

Project Butterfly is a multi-platform Tower Defense game with Pirates, Ninja, Zombies, Pandas, Demons and more!

  • Strengthen your defense with dozens of different Defenders.
  • Defend against the assault from a wide array of Attackers.
  • Select a unique Style for your forces: Pirate, Ninja, Zombie, Kitty and many more.
  • Completely Customize your army with your own colors, accessories and more.
  • Conquer time and space in the epic Singleplayer campaign.
  • Cooperative and Versus Multiplayer battles through the tubes of the internets.
  • Play dozens of Game Modes: Adventure, Survival, Sandbox, Challenge, and more.
  • Use Editors to create your own Levels, Defenders and Attackers and more.
  • Earn Achievements to show all the noobs how awesome you are.
  • Leaderboards for High Scores, Survival Waves, Speed Runs and more.
  • Cross-Platform gameplay on any platform; Computer, Console or Smartphone.
  • User Content means an infinite level of content, unlimited replayability!
  • Frequent Updates with moar improvements and content for you to consume.

 

 

The Developers

Mushroomblue is a small team of indie game developers based in Canada.

 

 

The Funding Goal

We need money for Licensing, ESRB Rating Fee, Steam Application Fee, and more to get this game released. Any extra donations will be put toward dev kits and ports to develop for more platforms.

story:
As featured on:

What is it?

The ultimate all-in-one-Retro console with a built-in DVD-RW drive to run games for Amiga CD32, Sony PlayStation, Sega Saturn*, Sega CD*, TurboGrafx* and more .

The (*)-marked Systems will require additional ROM files in order to work. Easy-to-follow installation-instructions are provided in our included user manual.

Of course it can also play ROMS for other consoles such as SNES/Super Famicom, Genesis/MegaDrive and more.

The indieGO! is silent, power efficient and very unique, when compared with other ARM-based consoles, because of the integrated DVD-Drive.

The Hardware consists of:

  • Raspberry Pi2 or Odroid C1 or Odroid XU4
  • DVD-RW drive allows to execute CD-Based AmigaCD32, Playstation and PC games 
  • front SD-Card reader
  • attractive mini-itx case
  • 3D-Printed I/O-shield and ARM-Cpu board holder
  • USB-Joypad
  • 2x Front- USB

The OS:

  • compatible to Linux (ARM and i386 binaries side by side) 
  • compatible to ARM AROS binaries 
  • Wine is included and allows the execution of Windows ARM And i386 Software 
  • boots fast. 
  • KODI (former known as XBMC) is included
  • Moonlight included to stream games from from your personal computer
  • AmiCloud (cloud without a traffic limit) 
  • EmuLA (emulatorlauncher) 
  • indieGO!-Appstore 
  • EmulationStation a front-end for several emulations
  • it is Open! You can modify it and run games from all available sources. The main idea is to run original CD32 and Playstation games but you can run everything! Get games from USB-stick, DVD/CD, Internet, Pi-store, indieGO!-Marketplace and so on

Pre-installed games include Doom (sharware), Quake (Shareware), Duke Nukem (Shareware) and Whacky Wheels (shareware) and Jim Power Full-Version - more are accessible from our appstore.

For games you add by yourself and which are normally played via Keyboard and mouse we will offer a joypad-mapping tool. (a Default mapping will cover a lot of games) - Of course you can also connect a USB-Keyboard and Mouse if you like to

Games downloaded from the indieGO!-store are ready2play (mapped to be played with a pad)


The system will keep itself updated. You get also access to a member area on our Websites www.aeros-os.org and www.indiego-gaming.com 

Unlike other "Retro-console campaigns" we will not just put a Raspberry Pi with a Retropie like distro on it..

Well... to be honest you can install it still if you like.. side by side or on top of our solution ; ) And to be even more honest you will get a dual boot to enable you both worlds.. 

Our system is called indieGO!-OS and is based on EmulationStation, Kodi, AEROS, AMC, indieGO!-Marketplace and EmuLA. 

AEROS itself is based on Debian linux and indieGO!-OS is again a fork of AEROS aimed for gaming and emulation purposes.

The indieGO! allows to choose between indieGO!-OS(™), AEROS and Android(™) - Just reboot into a indie-Console, a Android console or a Mini PC.

The system includes Exagear desktop which allows you to run Linux i386 and with Wine even Windows applications on it. Exagear itself costs money on other platforms.. We include it for free if you back us.

Unlike older "hand-glued" projects we offer you a real AppStore which will be filled with tons of free games, demos and commercial full versions of games for all kind of retro platforms but also NEW stuff exclusively for indieGO!-compatible systems.

But you are 100% free to add own stuff to your console from every existing source! Your home, your castle.

On top and included in the price is your own Cloud-Storage (25GB) to store games, data and media... just logIN on a friends machine and access your data from everywhere on the globe. 

In first Quarter we will also release a Android/IOS web app to access your AmiCloud from underway.

Hmm.. you got already a Raspberry Pi2 or Odroid? 

Don't worry you can just buy the Software on MicroSD-card! 

Our system can be based on Raspberry Pi2 or Odroid XU4.

So you can decide... With a XU4 you can play more modern games like Doom3 + Expansion or emulate a Dreamcast in full speed and run PC-Games like Counterstrike! 

We include a DVD-RW because so you can just insert Amiga CD32 and Playstation original games! And if you take care to include needed rom-files you can also run Saturn, SegaCD and other CD-based console games.

One special feature of indieGO!-OS is a recognition layer for PC and console games on CD/DVD. If you insert a ROM it will be scanned and a wizard will help you to add it to your library. No manual config is needed.

Insert, install run! = FUN


Controller options

The basic pack includes a digital/analog USB-Controller perfectly fitting the retrogamer needs

Optionally you can also use original controllers with USB-Adapters (see rewards)


Instant fun!

Plug and Play! With the launch of the console you will get access to the indieGO!-library which consists of Games (demos, full versions, shareware, public domain) of all platform the system is capable to emulate or execute natively. 

Remember: insert a disk an the system will install it.
If it is not recognized, just use the member-forum to request compatibility and we will work on it.

Games made for indieGO!

We are also working on some in-house productions like "Projekt Lila", "Oh no! More Aliens" and "Dudes on Fire" which will work on Amiga and indieGO! systems. 



Developers dream!

The indieGO!-Appstore is open to all developers and runs on all important systems! On top we can support you to develop and publish games for all out target systems. You can get more infos on www.indiego-gaming.com

http://www.facebook.com/indiegoretro

AmiCloud is included in desktop mode and in the Gaming Section! 

indieGO!- Games purchased on your console can be also played on your Amiga, PC or Mac




Can I use it as a Computer?

Yes you can. We included AEROS our own Distribution for ARM based mini Computers like the Raspberry Pi or Odroid series.



Have fun and please spread the word!

story:
My Story

Hi! My name is Aaron Styles! I'm an indie game maker. I'm currently studying programming at university and have worked in the games industry as a designer.

I've released a few games so far, check them out on my website.

The main reason I've put this up is becuase I have a great idea for a game, but I need someone to make some good art for it. And to do that I need some money to pay them.

What We Need & What You Get

So, I need to make this game look good. Very simple primitive shapes won't cut it for this game, so the main focus of the money will be going towards getting an artist to work on the project and create some awesome characters, environments and items. Any money left over from the artist will be going towards a musician and looking toward porting the game to other platforms and/or the next project after this one.

At the end of hte day, this game will go ahead, but the quality of the game all depends on raising this money.

Also, check out the perks, to see what you can get for your contributions!


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this campaign on your blogs/facebook/street lamps/twitter/community noticeboard/podcasts/forums.

Send in emails/messages to any and all gaming blogs.

find me an artist to work with that wants the money this raises :P

story:
---------------------------

-------------------

------------

NOTE: Indiegogo's Minimum Campaign Requirement For Money Raising Was 500$ This Dosen't Mean It Has To Be A Maximum Of 500$ To Meet Our Goal!

-----------

------------------

---------------------------------

Short Summary

Hello members of Cimmarian. I would like to thank you for considering to donate to our group servers! This will help us as a community to play together and have a place to call our own.

What You Get & What We Need

Servers will be private and community run, thus allowing it to be troll free and moderated.


Servers for games can run $90 a year. If all members helped chip in some money, we could have a server in no time and believe it or not, possibly multiple servers. Let's do some math! Yay! Let's assume out of 900 members, 500 are willing to donate 50 cents and let's say that servers are $90 per year. 5 servers, just like that to play in your favorite games, such as:

Left 4 Dead 2

Team Fortress 2

Killing Floor

Counter-Strike

Terraria

etc...

 

The Impact

Cimmarian as a group has grown! Everyone works hard to keep the group social and active with steam announcements and inviting new members. Our admins have been able to bring you many assets, such as: mods, skins packs, free games and sales news and forums. Now we need you, The Contributing Members of Cimmarian. We CAN'T do this without you!

story:
A tale of lost memories, personal connections, and deception. Die Nachtblume - The Night Flower is the story of Alexandra diCourtne - but it could be any of us.

The Story

Die Nachtblume - the Night Flower is a retro-style RPG centered on the character of Alexandra diCourtne, a pious young woman who wants nothing more than to help others. But she gets quickly caught up in a mission far beyond her understanding - and what happened that night would haunt her for the rest of her (new) unlife...

The player plays as Alexandra, and thus follows her story of survival among nightmares and monsters, foe and friend, in unraveling the tangles of what she finds herself caught up in. She finds companions along the way, as well as people that will test her strength and will in battle; each with their own secrets and stories.

Development on Die Nachtblume started June 2014, but it can't succeed without your help; custom music and art takes resources neither the developer (me) or the writer (Charles) has. You might recognize us from projects like http://www.studyofanime.com/ -  this is us expanding our storytelling, and using video games to do so.

Where Do the Funds Go?


Commissioning a song from Allison Curval of The Clockwork Dolls (who you can listen to on Bandcamp here: https://theclockworkdolls.bandcamp.com/ ) at the $500 mark;

Commissioning 45-60 minutes of music and sound design for the ENTIRE game thanks to Big City Sound Design (who you can listen to on Soundcloud here: https://soundcloud.com/big-city-sound-design ) at the $800 mark;

While the goal is set at a minimum of $650, remember that the more donated to the Die Nachtblume project, the more custom music, voice narration, and more we can put into the game!

Want to test the game and have your input count?
Check Die Nachtblume out on itch.io!


The Difference 

I mention that Die Nachtblume has a diverse cast. It does!

Die Nachtblume features:

  • A female protagonist who changes throughout the story;
  • A cast diverse in race, sexuality, AND gender;
  • Attention paid during development for accessibility concerns for players, such as the ability to change system window color, contrast, music/SFX volume levels, and key remapping. (The key remapping also extends to playing the game retro-style with an NES style controller, should you so wish!)


Risks & Challenges

If the campaign does not fund, we are doing flexible funding so that backers can still get their rewards, and so we can still improve the game.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Make some noise - word of mouth is still the best promotion!
  • Indiegogo has share tools; please use them!

story:
MORE GAMES GEARED TOWARDS CHRISTIAN CHILDREN

Statistics suggest that by the age of eight, 60% of children have played games or used apps on a portable device. Would it not be better that they played games hat instill Christian values?

It’s no secret that most of the gaming industry isn’t geared towards Christian gamers. Violent and immoral titles like ‘Grand Theft Auto’ and ‘Assassins Creed’ dominate the market, and while there are faith-based games like ‘Exodus’ and ‘King of Kings: The Early Years’, they can be hampered by a lack of excitement, and lower quality sound/visuals.

Kids are enticed by a full combination of great graphics, sound, and gameplay, but there are few if any games that manage to hold their attention while bringing them closer to their faith. It was a need to change this that led to the creation of the Doron Creations Inc., a Christian Gaming Company, and our first major title, Mighty Noah, which will be available for free, with ads, in the Google Play Store.

 

THE GAMEPLAY

Mighty Noah is an action-packed, 3D adventure/trivia mobile game in which you control Noah’s Ark as it transports the animals through the Great Flood. Simply: 

  • Swipe left or right to switch lanes
  • Swipe up or down to increase or decrease your speed
  • Avoid or get rid of obstacles in your path
  • Tap on power-ups/coins to collect them. 

Obstacles range from barrels, stones, and branches, to whales, sharks, and other animals, and your tools include a shield, bow and arrow, and a little help from above – lightning.

By keeping the ark safe for as long as you can, and answering Bible trivia along the way, you can achieve a high score, and be on the leaderboard with other players from around the world.

 

WHY CROWDFUNDING?

Development on Mighty Noah began over two years ago, and while countless hours and thousands of dollars have already been invested in this labor of love, we’ve hit a financial roadblock with only 80% of the game complete.

With your support, we’ll have the funding we need for Mighty Noah’s completion and official launch, as well as marketing and promotion, maintenance, and future game development.

 

THE IMPACT 

Our mission is to change the perception that Christian games are boring. We want to show that they can be action-packed, educational, and have the potential to take evangelizing to a whole other level. In addition:

  • It encourages kids to study the Bible in a fun, creative way
  • It provides Christian parents with more options to occupy their children
  • It keeps kids away from more ‘worldly’ games


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

With the $10,000 raised from this campaign, we’ll be able to:

  • Complete the rest of the development on Mighty Noah (only 20% remaining)
  • Advertise/market the game once it’s published
  • Begin development of other games planned for 2018/2019 (Wall of Jericho, Manna, Quail Catcher)

 

REWARDS

Please check out our reward tier, where you can get some cool perks, like having your name featured in the game credits. Because the game is being offered for free upon completion, we can’t give copies as rewards, but hope you’ll still see it as an investment in your children and the children of others. 

 

ABOUT THE CREATOR

 

Founder of Doron Creations Inc., Kumaran Ratnarajah, is a devout Christian and father of two. As a parent, he has had first-hand experience dealing with the social pressures to invest in games that have a negative effect on a child's mind at a young age. Through a combination of his personal interest in the gaming industry alongside the divine leading of the Holy Spirit, Kumaran began his journey to make a change in this booming industry. His main focus is to break the stigma that Christian games are under-stimulating and overtly religious but rather they are engaging, enjoyable and mentally stimulating.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The game is 80% complete at present and requires funding to get it to the launch stage. Our biggest risk right now is to miss our funding goal and have production pushed back indefinitely. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Share, share, share! Tell your friends and family about our project, and share the link to our campaign via your email and social media to show your support. Let’s get some wholesome gaming content to Christian children in 2018!

story:
Support Palm Kingdoms 3 on Steam Greenlight!

"Hi Guys! looks good so far! keep up the good work. I worked on HoMM 3 and 4 creating all of the skill and spell icons and HoMM interface graphics and would be interested in possibly helping out with your great game. Let me know if you might need something that I could provide. Good Luck!" 
Brian Kemper. Senior Artist 1997 - 2002, New World Computing

"Wow — your project is such a flashback!"
Lisa Farina. Assistant Designer 1994 – 2001, New World Computing
"Palm Kingdoms 3 is classic 'Heroes' gameplay at its finest"
Review at TouchArcade

Palm Kingdoms 3 is a heroes-inspired turn-based strategy for iOS, Android, Windows Phone, Mac OS X, and Windows.

  • If you played games like Heroes of Might and Magic (TM), or Civilization (TM) from the 1990s, this game is just what you enjoy to play.
  • If you are participating in Early Access for our Royal Bounty HD (download for Windows/Mac OS/Android) - then you know the level of attention to detail we will give to Palm Kingdoms 3.  



    • Gameplay.

    You use your heroes to explore the map, gather resources, hire armies, and conquer castles. 

    The castles are highly important for victory. In castles, you can build various constructions to improve your income, hire and upgrade monsters, learn new spells, and recruit heroes.
    We've got 7 castle types (and heroes), and each type has unique creatures, and playing strategy. We have Knight, Sorceress, Wizard, Barbarian, Necromancer, Warlock, and Varangian.
    The combat mode is also turn-based, and hexagonal, like the map. Each creature moves in its turn, according to its speed stat. Heroes can use one magic spell per round. Some creatures are melee, some are shooting, and some have the ability to fly over obstacles. 

    We learn from the best strategies of the 90's. We're keeping what you liked in them, and take it a step further. 

    Check out our work on Royal Bounty HD, an isometric one-hero RPG, built using the same game engine:



    The Graphics.

    We have hand-crafted pixel art graphics of huge size, suitable for modern ultra high-DPI screens. And it looks just fantastic.

    Interface.

    Palm Kingdoms 3 will get a major facelift. The mobile version will gain extra functionality, while keeping the interface minimal and simplistic.

    The Desktop version will have a full-fledged PC GUI. It will feel just the way a PC game should. 

    The Tablet version will use the desktop GUI, adapted for touch-screens.


    It is a very large project. And we want to make it right. We need extra artists, extra programmers, and map designers. And testing.

    Programming: this is a huge project, and we will hire extra programmers to speed up coding.

    Graphics: The biggest part of the total budget is reserved for pixel art sprites, and cut-scenes.

    Voice Acting and Soundtrack: This is another big part of the project development. We will use the funds to complete the soundtrack, and voice acting for cut-scenes.

    Level Design: this can only be done when the game is 100% complete. We will get experienced map makers that made maps for classic turn-based strategies.

    We have carefully thought about rewarding our backers. In addition to each reward tier, we add a bonus: a DRM-free copy of Dwarf Tower for Windows. 

     

    Moreover, each backer will get this bonus Dwarf Tower reward even if our campaign fails. 


    ------- 25,000: Campaign --------

    The most important thing we would like to be introducing in Palm Kingdoms 3 is the campaign mode. Playing single scenarios is fun enough, but you always wanted to be involved in something bigger. So here we are: introducing a story mode! It's main feature is non-linearity. You will have more that one way to complete it, resulting in different tactics. It has greater replay value, since every time you choose another playing style, you get different heroes, different spells and fight on different maps.


    - 30,000: Random Map Generator -

    What really adds the replay value is the long-awaited random map generator. A good random map generator must give you challenging and non-trivial maps that can be still be passed if you try hard enough.

    ------- 40,000: Improved AI -------- 

    Palm Kingdoms 2 Artificial Intelligence was good enough. However, experienced players new how to trick it into doing something stupid, like buying ships constantly or taking unnecessary risk. It all has changed now. The AI in Palm Kingdoms 3 will be significantly improved with random elements added and challenge increased

    ---- 50,000: Built-in Map Editor ----- 

    Building maps for Palm Kingdoms was always complicated because the official Map Editor was only available on Microsoft Windows. Not anymore! We are going to built a fully-functional map editor right into the game. You can change the world as you go. Then click Save and that's it. A new map is ready. Perfect, isn't it?

    ------- 60,000: Linux Version -------- 

    Linux gaming is growing. It is important for us to provide Linux users with a quality build for most popular Linux versions.

    ------- 80,000: Mods Support -------- 

    For all of you who always want some more there is one feature of Palm Kingdoms 3: the mod studio. Now you can tweak each and every aspect of the game: monster costs, map rules, visitable buildings actions, spells, castles and so on. Beware! You really need to think what you are doing. Ruthless customizing might ruin the game for you or even make it unplayable!

    ---- 100,000: Online Multiplayer ---- 

    The most hard thing to properly implement in such a complex project is multiplayer mode. Palm Kingdoms 1 even had one back in good old WinMobile days. Of what we understand one thing: a turn-by-turn mode is boring. That's why we are introducing a simultaneous turns concept, like in Civilization series. You can play against your friends (or complete strangers) via Wi-Fi connection, or on our online server.

    iosoftware is a small, experienced indie development team, focused on pixel art games. We are dedicated on true games the way many people remember them from the childhood. We believe that something very important was lost on the way to 3d graphics and large-scale production. Something that needs to be recovered.

    if you're an iOS user, make sure to check out our Palm Kingdoms 2 for iPad, and iPhone.

    All our iOS games can be found here.

story:
Update: The campaign is now over. Thank you all so much for your support!

Missed the deadline? Premium CraftStudio accounts are now available at http://craftstud.io/

Previous Update: It would appear that WE HAVE REACHED OUR FUNDING GOAL!!! Thank you all for your support, the months ahead are going to be packed with lots of fun and a quite a bit of work too! :D

You can still donate and spread the word, every penny will help us make CraftStudio and Project Waffle bigger, better and faster.

You can take CraftStudio for a spin by grabbing a pre-alpha build at craftstud.io

Games with user-generated content like Minecraft, Little Big Planet or Trackmania have made it clear that lots of gamers are creative at their heart and that, provided with the right tools, you guys can and want to build awesome stuff.

User-made maps are great, but we can do better! Introducing...

Real-time collaborative game-making, for the masses

CraftStudio is a multiplayer platform to create games and interactive movies. It's about empowering gamers and blurring the line between playing and creating.

It makes a few trade-offs (a low-poly, pixel-arty look) to allow gamers with no particular experience to:

  • Create, paint and animate 3D models (characters, objects) out of blocks.
  • Craft infinite maps (think Minecraft’s creative mode), painting your own blocks to create whatever universe you want.
  • Give life to their worlds using a visual scripting system.

It’s all real-time, you can collaborate with friends or strangers over the Internet. You can set up your own server or join an existing project.

 
Mockup of the new user interface for CraftStudio Alpha (click for full version)

The Platform

  • It just works: Choose a name for your game project, send a link to your friends, you're up and running!
  • Simple, straight-forward editing tools, rethought to be usable by mere mortals.
  • Community of people to partner with and projects to contribute to.
  • A store to find and publish models, maps, behaviors or entire games. The idea is that you'll be able to share stuff on the store for free or charge for it. Note that you don't have to use the store. You will be able to export your game and distribute / sell it without owing me anything!
  • Much more:
    • Built-in revision system, you can go back in time and restore old versions of your assets. (already implemented)
    • Collaborative rich-text document editing à la Google Docs for laying out your game's story or gameplay mechanics (already implemented)
    • Project access policies & moderation features so you can choose whether your project is private or anyone can join and help. No text files editing, it's all part of the main client. (partly implemented)
    • It will run on Windows / MacOS X / Linux when finished (currently Windows-only)
By removing the technical hurdles and connecting people with one another, I hope CraftStudio will start a revolution in how games are built. Instead of closed teams, games could be made by random people joining forces over the Internet, learning from one another and tapping into their previously under-used creativity. Through a simple, cohesive and affordable platform, I want to foster cooperation and exchange.

How will the money be used?

The funds will go towards:
  • Keeping me working full-time on CraftStudio for the coming months, so I can fulfill my original vision and integrate your feedback!
  • Paying server, bandwidth, hardware & other day-to-day costs. Right now the costs are pretty low but they will increase as more people start using CraftStudio. Also porting to MacOS X might require that I buy a Mac.
  • Funding the development of the first CraftStudio game, codename "Project Waffle". If the fundraising goal is reached, 2D / 3D artist Thomas Frick will join me to create a dungeon crawler with CraftStudio. Making this game will allow me to improve the editing tools along the way, benefiting the entire community.
 

Do I own the stuff I make with CraftStudio?

Everything you'll make with CraftStudio is yours. Various export options are planned. You don't have to publish using the built-in store, you can take your game / movie, export it and do whatever you want with it, even publish it on your own and make money off it.
 
If you decide to use the built-in store (which has yet to be designed), I'll take a cut for hosting and to be able to keep improving CraftStudio. But if you don't want to use the store, you can sell your games on your own website or whatever and you owe me nothing. Also, there won't be any mandatory watermarking or anything.
 
The Luggage from Discworld by Rémy Maetz (click for a timelapse video of its creation)

Some background

My name's Elisée Maurer, I'm a 22-years-old game developer from Strasbourg, France. I picked up programming when I was 8 and have worked on countless games & apps ever since, learning along the way. I spent 3 years as a programmer at Creative Patterns working on several titles including QuadSmash.
 
Making games and movies is awesome and I want people to do it and have fun. Having someone play something you made with your little hands is an amazing feeling. You shouldn't be held back because the tools suck, and that's why I'm building better tools!
 
You can check out my one-man company's website here: http://sparklinlabs.com/
 
Moar videos, screenshots, pre-alpha build
If you want to see more CraftStudio action, check out the following links:
  • The CraftStudio YouTube channel has a few videos introducing new releases and features
  • Development log on TIGSource with screenshots & info about the development process
  • Pictures of community-made models on CraftStudio's Facebook page
  • CraftStud.io - the official website where you can grab a pre-alpha build of CraftStudio
 
 

Contact

Feel free to shoot me an e-mail at elisee at craftstud.io if you have any questions or just want to say hi!
You can also find us on Twitter: @elisee and @ThomasFrick

Help spread the word

Get your friends excited by sharing this campaign on Twitter (awesome two-click tweet sauce!), Facebook or Google+. You can also submit this page on Reddit or Hacker News. Any little bit helps! Thanks a lot!

story:
Dr. Space invites you on a cosmic journey:

  • The game creates an experience that feels like diving inside an album cover, tripping inside a psychedelic video. 
  • We are an experienced team of passionate space rock fans who want to provide you new methods to enjoy astral spaces. 
  • We need Your support to build the astral world a better place. We have created an initial version of the game as a proof-of-concept. With your help we can get the game published.


Astral sphere is a world of immaterial beings. It consists of astral plane layers. Oresund is the medium connecting the tangible world with the intangible astral sphere. The pipelines and the record players act as the portals to other layers.


 You are Dr. Space. Your ultimate goal is to find the abducted band members. Ride on the mushroom clouds and dive down the pipelines of love. Bring the band members safely back to Oresund.

Øresund Space Collective is a music collective from Denmark and Sweden that plays totally improvised space rock. Dr. Space is the captain of the Space Collective. The band has released 14 albums.

Gameplay matters. We focus on making the gameplay an enjoyable experience. The game combines both epic and casual entertainment. Game world is open ended, designed to be played in a variety of ways with world exploration, survival and social hangouts all blended together. Play as you feel like: casual quick play or an infinite adventure with challenging moments. Game suits for serious gamers and non-gamers who only want to float in psychedelic spaces enjoying the music. During the gameplay you use different control mechanisms:

  • Use wrecking ball to control Dr. Space across the astral planes. 
  • Detach Dr. Space from the wrecking ball to land on surfaces and to enable the shooting mode. 
  • Lift up abducted people and bring them back to the heart of Oresund.


Meet other like-minded players online in the astral sphere:

  • You can drop magic pills and create visual hallucinative effects to the space, and they will appear to all other players who are online.
  • All players interact with the same instances of the game objects. For example if you are lifting up a band member and accidentally drop him, another player can catch him. 
  • Hang out with other players in the studio room and follow the social events from the astral sphere. 


PROJECT EXPENSES

We need Your support to build the astral world a better place. Financing for:

Art asset licenses, Development, Graphical design, Servers, Sounds, Music.

STRETCH GOALS

+ 1200 EUR: 5 ASTRAL PLANES FOR ASTRAL ORESUND

Additional astral planes implemented. Design sketches are shared on Facebook for your comments.

+ 2200 EUR: 4 NEW SPECIAL ASTRAL PLANES

We implement new astral plane according to your ideas and graphical style. The ideas are shared on game's Facebook page.

+ 3000 EUR: 5 NEW SONGS TO ALBUM + 2 NEW ASTRAL PLANES

5 new Oresund Space Collective songs are added to the digital soundtrack album.

+ 10 000 EUR: ASTRAL SPHERE EDITOR

Create your custom planets and astral planes for other players.

TEAM

Dr. Space is the supervisor and spiritual leader of the game project. MaSa is the game architect, designer and programmer. Martin is the graphical designer. Dan is the narrator. Jussi is the server programmer.

SCHEDULE

MILESTONE: August the 1st: User Testing with Hard Core Gamers. Testing the Pre-Alpha version at Assembly Helsinki, one of biggest nordic gaming events.

MILESTONE: August the 20th: Alpha Version.

MILESTONE: September the 10th: Beta Version.

MILESTONE: October 17th: Game version 1.0 Launch Party. Oresund Space Collective is on Nordic tour playing two concerts in Finland (Helsinki and Loimaa). The game will be introduced during the shows. 

RISKS

RISK: SPACED OUT. When a bunch of hippies start a project…they might get lost on faraway planets.  -> No Worries: this project is bullet proof. We all are trusted in delivering projects such as Dr. Space with 14 albums released in 10 years, MaSa and Jussi delivered over 20 IT projects.

RISK: GAME GETS UNINTERESTING AND TOO GENERIC. If we try to please too many different kind of users we easily lose the rebel-edgy-twist of the game. -> We must listen to all the ideas and opinions and recognize the things that really matter to make the astral trip a cool experience. 

RISK: FOCUSING ON NITTY-GRITTY DETAILS AND LOSING FOCUS OF THE BIG PICTURE. There is often a temptation to polish tiny less important details which causes delays to overall progress. ->  The whole team will keep the focus on commonly agreed work items. For example getting the overall design of an astral plane ready instead of polishing the shape of a single mushroom object.

RISK: SCOPE CREEP. Continuous growth in a game's scope. When the game progresses new ideas arise all the time. -> The minimum scope of the first deliverable version will be tightly fixed when the IndieGoGo campaign ends. This helps to keep the goal clear. 

Support us to make the Oresund astral world a better place. Thanks!
