story:
Click here for english version

Exercices ludiques cognitifs sur internet pour s'entraîner et rester motivé pour les patients et tout ceux qui souhaitent entraîner leur mémoire.


Pour qui ?

  • Pour les personnes de tout âge atteintes de troubles cognitifs :
    • Dans la Maladie d'Alzheimer et les pathologies associées,
    • Dans les AVC, les Traumatismes Crâniens,
  • Pour les personnes désireuses d’entretenir leur mémoire et leur concentration.

Dans quel contexte?

  • Avec des professionnels de santé, qui choisiront les exercices les plus adaptés aux difficultés du patient dans le cadre d’un programme de rééducation ou de stimulation cognitive, en cabinet médical ou en centre Mémoire, ou encore en continuité des soins en institution
  • A domicile, selon ses propres besoins et à son initiative personnelle pour entrainer sa mémoire, sa concentration ou toute autre fonction cognitive.

Quelle innovation ?

  • Ce sont les cliniciens et les usagers qui sont à l’origine des jeux
  • Ces jeux sont développés très rapidement, directement au sein d'une équipe composée de cliniciens et d'ingénieurs
  • Ces jeux sont gratuits pour les usagers. Vous pouvez les tester dès maintenant sur le site www.memory-motivation.org

Le contexte

La mémoire est une fonction qui permet d’apprendre et de conserver toutes sortes d’informations, dans le but de les réutiliser par la suite. C’est la mémoire qui permet de reconnaître des objets et des personnes, en associant leur aspect avec leur nom et leur fonction. C’est également la mémoire qui permet d’apprendre à parler ou à faire du vélo, en apprenant les successions de gestes à produire. C’est encore la mémoire qui nous permet de raisonner, en faisant appel à des concepts abstraits que l’on a déjà mémorisés, pour les appliquer sur de nouvelles informations.

La mémorisation se décompose en plusieurs étapes : l’encodage des informations, leur stockage, et leur récupération. Il est possible d’améliorer sa mémoire en s’exerçant à mieux encoder les informations, pour récupérer plus facilement les souvenirs par la suite.

Il en va de même pour les autres fonctions cognitives : l’attention (qui permet de se concentrer longtemps sur quelque chose, ou de faire plusieurs choses à la fois), les fonctions exécutives (qui permettent de planifier ses actions, de s’organiser, ou encore de raisonner sur des choses complexes), le langage (qui permet de s’exprimer, en choisissant les termes corrects, sans hésiter sur les mots).

Tous ces aspects de la cognition sont des éléments essentiels d’un bon fonctionnement dans les activités quotidiennes, et d’une bonne qualité de vie, en particulier lorsqu’ils sont associés à une bonne motivation. La mémoire et la motivation, ainsi que d’autres fonctions cognitives, peuvent être altérées par de nombreuses pathologies cérébrales, comme la maladie d’Alzheimer ou encore un Accident Vasculaire Cérébral.

  • Entrainer sa mémoire et les autres processus cognitifs peut donc contribuer à maintenir une bonne autonomie. Pour cela, il est indispensable de disposer d’exercices ludiques et motivants, et donc d’avoir du plaisir tout en s’entraînant.

En France il existe un réseau de 506 Centres Mémoire. Chacun de ces centres adresse des informations, pour chaque consultation, à une base de données Nationale (la BNA). En Février 2015, il y avait 579.798patients dans cette base de données.

8,9%  de ces sujets présentaient une plainte mnésique, et 59% une Maladie d'Alzheimer ou une pathologie associée. Cet instantané reflète une situation qui est commune à de nombreux pays.

En dehors des consultations pour faire une évaluation et un diagnostic, et des quelques traitements médicamenteux disponibles, il est important de proposer aux patients et aux familles des solutions pour entraîner la mémoire et les fonctions cognitives d'une manière motivante et innovante.

Qui sommes nous ?

Créée en 2011, Innovation Alzheimer (IA) est une association de loi 1901 qui a pour principal objectif de mettre l’innovation au service des usagers, tout particulièrement pour les personnes présentant une maladie d’Alzheimer, des pathologies apparentées ou des troubles neuropsychiatriques.

http://www.innovation-alzheimer.fr/accueil/

IA est composée de psychologues, de médecins, d’ingénieurs et de chercheurs.

A l’interaction entre clinique et recherche, IA est la structure idéale pour àla fois développer et valider en clinique des solutions innovantes.

L’association IA est le support de l’équipe de recherche CoBTeK (Cognition Behavior Technologies) de l’Universitéde Nice Sophia-Antipolis et du CMRR (Centre Mémoire de Ressources et de Recherche) du CHU de Nice, dirigés par le Professeur Philippe Robert. 

IA est une association sans but lucratif.

IA est localisée à l’Institut Claude Pompidou à Nice, France.

Dans le cadre de la recherche, IA est déjà impliquée dans de nombreux projets de recherche nationaux ou internationaux:

FP7: Dem@Care: http://www.demcare.eu/

FP7 VERVE: http://verveconsortium.eu/

FP7 IN MINDD: http://www.inmindd.eu/

AZ@GAME Investissements d’Avenir Développement de l’Economie Numérique AAP e-santé n°1: Santé et autonomie sur le lieu de vie grâce au numérique : http://www.azagame.fr/

SafEE (Safe and Easy Environment for Alzheimer’s disease) ANR –13 –TECS –0002 –0.

IA est aussi impliquée dans la prévention et la formation:

  • En réalisant pour la ville de Nice des ateliers mémoire depuis plus de 3 ans
  • En organisant des réunions de formations et un workshop annuel, qui en 2014 a rassemblé plus de 300 personnes

Azur TV - Reportage sur les exercices ludiques à l'occasion du workshop

France 5 - Allo Docteurs - Reportage sur l'utilisation des exercices ludiques pour les patients atteints de la maladie d'AlzheimerFrance 3 Régions - Les jeux vidéo pour

France 3 Côte d'azur - Reportages sur les exercices ludiques

Notre motivation

MeMo est la suite logique aux actions de recherche et de soins de l’association IA : offrir aux usagers le moyen de continuer à entrainer et stimuler cognition et motivation, indépendamment des visites dans un Centre Mémoire.

En tant que professionnels de santé, nous prenons en charge des patients atteints de troubles cognitifs lors de consultation médicale ou d’ateliers de stimulation mnésique. Mais également, nous animons des ateliers de prévention pour les séniors soucieux d’entrainer leur mémoire. Les personnes dont nous nous occupons nous demandent souvent comment continuer à s’exercer chez eux. 

Nous avons essayé plusieurs solutions, mais malheureusement aucune ne répond à ce besoin de façon satisfaisante tant sur le plan de l’efficacité thérapeutique qu’en terme d’accessibilité financière. 

Nous souhaitons développer une solution qui pallie à tous ces manques :

  • Conçue par des professionnels de santé,
  • Développée directement et rapidement dans l’équipe
  • Adaptée selon le niveau d’efficience cognitive,
  • Accessible à tous gratuitement
  • Multi-langues

Notre méthode de travail

Nous avons défini une méthode de travail pour atteindre nos objectifs rapidement et efficacement qui met à contribution du début à la fin du processus toutes les compétences dont nous disposons.

Nous organisons chaque fin de mois des tests utilisateurs, 2 ont déjà eu lieu, en janvier et février.

Budget

Le financement a pour objectif d'engager des prestataires pour apporter la main d’œuvre supplémentaire nécessaire à la réalisation du projet (développement, graphismes, ergonomie). 

Aujourd'hui, le projet MeMo a pu démarrer grâce aux fonds propres de l'association et grâce àdes premiers dons, notamment du Lions Club International District Côte d'Azur.

Nous souhaitons sur 1 an financer les moyens humains et matériels pour :

  • Développer 12 exercices ludiques pour tablettes et PC,
  • Organiser des évènements de tests et de présentation du projet,
  • Sécuriser le projet en définissant un modèle économique viable, social et non lucratif,
  • Cadeaux de remerciements.

Si nous ne collectons pas la totalité des fonds demandés, les doncs collectés seront utilsés avce les mêmes objectifs mais nosu développerons moins de jeux.

Comment nous aider ?

  • En envoyant un chèque directement à l'association (Innovation Alzheimer, Institut Claude Pompidou, 10 rue Molière, 06100 Nice),

  • En faisant un don directement sur le site d'Indiegogo (avec ou sans contrepartie) en cliquant sur "Contribuer Maintenant", puis "Aller sur le site Paypal" (équivalent du Crédit Agricole par exemple), puis "Payer par Carte bancaire", sélectionnez "France" et décochez la case "Enregistrer avec un compte PayPal".

  • En partageant ce projet sur les réseaux sociaux en utilisant les boutons twitter, facebook ou google+ en haut de la page, ou/et en utilisant  sur twitter #MakeMeMoHappen,

  • En parlant de ce projet autour de vous !

Merci à tous !

English version

For Whom?

  • For persons of any age with cognitive impairment
    • Persons with Alzheimer’s disease and related disorders
    • Persons who had a stroke or a traumatic brain injury
  • For everyone willing to train his/her memory, concentration and other cognitive functions

Where and with whom?

  • With clinicians, who will select the exercises most adapted to the patient’s difficulties in the context of a rehabilitation program or of a cognitive stimulation activity. In the consultation office, or at the memory center, or in institution.
  • At home, based on the personal needs and willingness to train any cognitive function

Which innovation?

MeMo is an innovative project because :

  • The games are conceived by the clinicians together with the final users
  • The games are developed very rapidly by a team including clinicians and engineers
  • The games are online and free for the users. You can test them with the following link (soon in english) : www.memory-motivation.org

The context

Memory is the cognitive function which allows learning and storing information, to be re-used later. Memory allows to recognize objects and persons, and to associate the person’s aspect to her name and function. Memory allows learning talking and biking, by storing the sequence of movements to be performed. Memory also sustains reasoning, thanks to the abstract concepts memorized before that can be applied to new domains and information.

Memory is a multi-stage ability, which includes information encoding, storage and recovery. Memory can be improved by training our ability to encode the information. Better encoded information will be easier to recover in a second moment.

Similar observations can apply to other cognitive functions, such as attention (which allows to concentrate on something for a long time, or to make several things at the same time), executive functions (which allow actions planning and organization, or to perform complex reasoning), and language (which allows us to express ourselves using the right words without any difficulty).

All these aspects of cognition are crucial for a normal functioning in the activities of daily living, and for a good quality of life, in particular when associated to high motivation. Memory and motivation, similarly to the other cognitive functions, can be impaired due to different brain diseases, such as Alzheimer’s disease or a stroke.

Training our memory and the other cognitive functions can contribute to maintain a good autonomy. But to train ourselves it is necessary to have exercises which are entertaining and motivating, so that we can have fun while working.

In France there is a network of 506 Memory Centers. Every center enters the data collected for each patient, and for each consultation, into a national database (BNA, Banque Nationale Alzheimer). In February 2015, the BNA contained data from 579.798 patients.

8,9% of these patients presented a subjective memory complaint, and 59% had Alzheimer’s disease or related disorders. These numbers are aligned to what happens in many other countries.

In addition to the consultations for assessment and diagnosis, and to the few existing pharmacological treatments, it is important to propose to the patients and their families solutions to train the memory and other cognitive functions in a motivating and innovative way.

Who we are

Created in 2011, Innovation Alzheimer (IA) is an association (law 1901) which aims at putting innovation at service of users, specifically of people suffering from Alzheimer’s disease and related disorders, and from neuropsychiatric problems.

http://www.innovation-alzheimer.fr/accueil/

IA includes psychologists, medical doctors, engineers and researchers. Thanks to the close interaction between clinical work and research, IA is the ideal place to develop and validate innovative solutions in the clinical domain.

IA sustains and supports the research team CoBTeK (Cognition Behavior Technologies) of the Universityof Nice Sophia Antipolis and of the CMRR (Centre Mémoire de Ressources et de Recherche) of the Nice Hospitals, directed by Professor Philippe Robert. 

IA is a non-profit association.

IA is located at the Institut Claude Pompidou in Nice, France.

In the research domain, IA is already involved in many national and international research projects:

  • FP7 Dem@Care : http://www.demcare.eu/
  • FP7 VERVE : http://verveconsortium.eu/
  • FP7 IN MINDD : http://www.inmindd.eu/
  • AZ@GAME "Investissements d’Avenir Développement de l’Economie Numérique AAP e-santé n°1 : Santé et autonomie sur le lieu de vie grâce au numérique" : http://www.azagame.fr/
  • SafEE (Safe and Easy Environment for Alzheimer’s disease) ANR –13 –TECS –0002 –0.

IA is also involved into prevention and education activities:

  • Since 3 years, IA organizes memory workshops for elderly people of the Nice Municipality,
  • It organizes training meetings and events, and an annual workshop, which in 2014 has been followed by more than 300 peopl.

Azur TV - French news report on serious games during annual workshop

France 5 - Allo Docteurs - French health programme with a report about serious games for Alzheimer patients

France 3 Régions - French news report on serious games for Alzheimer patients

Our motivation

MeMo is the natural consequence of the research and clinical activities of the IA association: it is meant to offer to the users a way to keep training and stimulating their cognitive functions outside the visits done at the Memory Center.

In quality of health professionals, we work with patients with cognitive impairment during clinical consultations and workshops dedicated to memory stimulation. But we also organize workshops more focused on prevention of memory loss, dedicated to healthy seniors willing to train their memory. All these people (patients and healthy eledely people) often ask us how they can keep training at home.

We explored several existing solutions, but unfortunately none of them was completely adapted to satisfy this need, either because the therapeutic efficacy was unknown, either because they were too expensive.

Our aim is to develop a solution which can fix all these issues. Our solution:

  • Is conceived and designed by health professionals
  • Is developed directly and rapidly by our team
  • Is adaptable to different levels of cognitive functioning
  • Is free and accessible to everyone online
  • Is multi-language

Our method

To reach rapidly and effectively our goal we defined a work method which makes use of all the competence available from the beginning to the end of the process.

Users tests are organized monthly. the first 2 users tests have been realized in January and February 2015.

Budget

The funding will be employed to consult experts working on specific aspects of the project (game development, graphics and ergonomic).

MeMo project started thanks to the funds of the association IA and to some early donations, in particular those of the Lions Club International District Côte d'Azur.

Now we aim at funding persons and materials for 1 year in order to:

  • Develop 12 motivating exercises for tablet
  • Organize events to present the project and test the games
  • Define a viable business model to keep our social non-profit nature
  • To thank the donations with rewards

If we won't manage to collect all the funds, we will use the available funds for the very same objectives, reducing the number of games.

How can you make MeMo happen ?

  • Making a donation (you can choose a reward or not)

  • Sharing this project on social networks thanks to twitter, facebook or google+ buttons at the top of the page, or/and use #MakeMeMoHappen
  • Talking about this project to people around you

Thanks to all
story_txt:
Click here for english version 
Exercices ludiques cognitifs sur internet pour s'entraîner et rester motivé pour les patients et tout ceux qui souhaitent entraîner leur mémoire. 


Pour qui ?


Pour
les personnes de tout âge atteintes de troubles cognitifs : 


Dans la Maladie d'Alzheimer et les pathologies associées,

Dans les AVC, les Traumatismes Crâniens,


Pour les
personnes désireuses d’entretenir leur mémoire et leur concentration.


Dans quel contexte? 


Avec
des professionnels de santé, qui choisiront les exercices les plus adaptés aux
difficultés du patient dans le cadre d’un programme de rééducation ou de
stimulation cognitive, en cabinet médical ou en centre Mémoire, ou encore en
continuité des soins en institution

A
domicile, selon ses propres besoins et à son initiative personnelle pour
entrainer sa mémoire, sa concentration ou toute autre fonction cognitive. 
Quelle innovation ? 



Ce sont les
cliniciens et les
usagers qui sont à l’origine des jeux

Ces
jeux sont développés très rapidement, directement au sein d'une équipe composée
de cliniciens et d'ingénieurs

Ces jeux sont gratuits
pour les usagers. Vous pouvez les tester dès maintenant sur le site www.memory-motivation.org




Le contexte
La mémoire est une fonction qui permet
d’apprendre et de conserver toutes sortes d’informations, dans le but de les
réutiliser par la suite. C’est la mémoire qui permet de reconnaître des objets
et des personnes, en associant leur aspect avec leur nom et leur fonction.
C’est également la mémoire qui permet d’apprendre à parler ou à faire du vélo,
en apprenant les successions de gestes à produire. C’est encore la mémoire qui
nous permet de raisonner, en faisant appel à des concepts abstraits que l’on a
déjà mémorisés, pour les appliquer sur de nouvelles informations.
La
mémorisation se décompose en plusieurs étapes : l’encodage des
informations, leur stockage, et leur récupération. Il est possible d’améliorer
sa mémoire en s’exerçant à mieux encoder les informations, pour récupérer plus
facilement les souvenirs par la suite.
Il
en va de même pour les autres fonctions cognitives : l’attention (qui
permet de se concentrer longtemps sur quelque chose, ou de faire plusieurs
choses à la fois), les fonctions exécutives (qui permettent de planifier ses
actions, de s’organiser, ou encore de raisonner sur des choses complexes), le
langage (qui permet de s’exprimer, en choisissant les termes corrects, sans
hésiter sur les mots). 
Tous
ces aspects de la cognition sont des éléments essentiels d’un bon
fonctionnement dans les activités quotidiennes, et d’une bonne qualité de vie,
en particulier lorsqu’ils sont associés à une bonne motivation. La mémoire et
la motivation, ainsi que d’autres fonctions cognitives, peuvent être altérées
par de nombreuses pathologies cérébrales, comme la maladie d’Alzheimer ou
encore un Accident Vasculaire Cérébral.
Entrainer
sa mémoire et les autres processus cognitifs peut donc contribuer à maintenir une
bonne autonomie. Pour cela, il est indispensable de disposer d’exercices
ludiques et motivants, et donc d’avoir du plaisir tout en s’entraînant.
En
France il existe un réseau de 506 Centres Mémoire. Chacun de ces centres
adresse des informations, pour chaque consultation, à une base de données
Nationale (la BNA). En Février 2015, il y avait 579.798patients dans
cette base de données.
8,9%  de ces sujets présentaient une plainte
mnésique, et 59% une Maladie d'Alzheimer ou une pathologie associée. Cet instantané
reflète une situation qui est commune à de nombreux pays.
En
dehors des consultations pour faire une évaluation et un diagnostic, et des
quelques traitements médicamenteux disponibles, il est important de proposer
aux patients et aux familles des solutions pour entraîner la mémoire et les
fonctions cognitives d'une manière motivante et innovante. 



Qui sommes nous ?
Créée en 2011,
Innovation Alzheimer (IA) est une association de loi 1901 qui a pour principal
objectif de mettre l’innovation au service
des usagers, tout particulièrement pour les
personnes présentant une
maladie d’Alzheimer, des
pathologies apparentées ou des troubles
neuropsychiatriques.

http://www.innovation-alzheimer.fr/accueil/

IA est composée de psychologues, de
médecins, d’ingénieurs et de chercheurs.
A l’interaction entre clinique et recherche, IA est la structure idéale pour àla fois développer et valider en clinique des solutions
innovantes.
L’association IA est
le support de l’équipe de recherche
CoBTeK (Cognition Behavior Technologies) de l’Universitéde Nice Sophia-Antipolis et du CMRR (Centre Mémoire de Ressources et de Recherche) du CHU de Nice, dirigés par le
Professeur Philippe Robert.  
IA est une association sans but lucratif.
IA est localisée à l’Institut Claude
Pompidou à Nice, France.
Dans le cadre de la recherche, IA est déjà impliquée dans de nombreux
projets de recherche nationaux ou internationaux:
FP7: Dem@Care: http://www.demcare.eu/
FP7 VERVE: http://verveconsortium.eu/
FP7 IN MINDD: http://www.inmindd.eu/
AZ@GAME Investissements d’Avenir Développement de l’Economie Numérique AAP e-santé n°1: Santé et autonomie sur le lieu de vie grâce au numérique : http://www.azagame.fr/
SafEE (Safe and Easy Environment for Alzheimer’s disease) ANR –13 –TECS –0002 –0.
IA est aussi impliquée dans la prévention et la formation:

En réalisant pour la ville de Nice des ateliers mémoire depuis plus
de 3 ans
En organisant des réunions de
formations et un workshop annuel, qui en 2014 a rassemblé plus de 300 personnes 

Azur TV - Reportage sur les exercices ludiques à l'occasion du workshopFrance 5 - Allo Docteurs - Reportage sur l'utilisation des exercices ludiques pour les patients atteints de la maladie d'AlzheimerFrance 3 Régions - Les jeux vidéo pour France 3 Côte d'azur - Reportages sur les exercices ludiques

Notre
motivation
MeMo est la suite logique aux actions de recherche
et de soins de l’association IA : offrir aux usagers le moyen de continuer
à entrainer et stimuler cognition et motivation, indépendamment des visites
dans un Centre Mémoire.
En tant que
professionnels de santé, nous prenons en charge des patients atteints de
troubles cognitifs lors de consultation médicale ou d’ateliers de stimulation
mnésique. Mais également, nous animons des ateliers de prévention pour les
séniors soucieux d’entrainer leur mémoire. Les personnes dont nous nous
occupons nous demandent souvent comment continuer à s’exercer chez eux. 
Nous avons
essayé plusieurs solutions, mais malheureusement aucune ne répond à ce besoin
de façon satisfaisante tant sur le plan de l’efficacité thérapeutique qu’en
terme d’accessibilité financière.  
Nous
souhaitons développer une solution qui pallie à tous ces manques : 


Conçue par des professionnels de santé,

Développée directement et rapidement dans l’équipe

Adaptée selon le niveau d’efficience cognitive,

Accessible à tous gratuitement
Multi-langues



Notre méthode de travail
Nous avons défini une méthode de travail
pour atteindre nos objectifs rapidement et efficacement qui met à contribution du début à la fin du
processus toutes les compétences dont nous disposons.Nous organisons chaque fin de mois des tests utilisateurs, 2 ont déjà eu lieu, en janvier et février. 


Budget
Le
financement a pour objectif d'engager des prestataires pour apporter la main
d’œuvre supplémentaire nécessaire à la réalisation du projet (développement,
graphismes, ergonomie). Aujourd'hui,
le projet MeMo a pu démarrer grâce aux fonds propres de l'association et
grâce àdes premiers dons,
notamment du Lions Club International District Côte d'Azur.
Nous
souhaitons sur 1 an financer les moyens humains et matériels pour :


Développer 12 exercices
ludiques pour tablettes et PC,


Organiser des évènements de tests et de présentation du projet,


Sécuriser le projet en définissant un modèle économique viable, social et
non lucratif,


Cadeaux de remerciements. 

Si nous ne collectons pas la totalité des fonds demandés, les doncs collectés seront utilsés avce les mêmes objectifs mais nosu développerons moins de jeux. 

Comment nous aider ? 


En envoyant un chèque directement à l'association (Innovation Alzheimer, Institut Claude Pompidou, 10 rue Molière, 06100 Nice),
En faisant un don directement sur le site d'Indiegogo (avec ou sans contrepartie) en cliquant sur "Contribuer Maintenant", puis "Aller sur le site Paypal" (équivalent du Crédit Agricole par exemple), puis "Payer par Carte bancaire", sélectionnez "France" et décochez la case "Enregistrer avec un compte PayPal".
En partageant ce projet sur les réseaux sociaux en utilisant les boutons twitter, facebook 
ou google+ en haut de la page, ou/et en utilisant  sur twitter #MakeMeMoHappen, 
En parlant de ce projet autour de vous ! 

Merci à tous !

story:
Kasaria is an upcoming virtual pet site / rpg mix! Players partner up with a companion, which will help you settle into Kasaria to explore, battle, and more. The more time you spend with your companions, the quicker they'll learn English so that they can communicate more easily with you. Of course, the alternative is that you could learn their language instead!


Involve yourself with your Human Avatar. Dress up to your heart's content and level it up through a variety of tasks to explore further areas of Kasaria.

Customize your companion too with many accessories! All companions (apart from the basic colors) have unique poses, so you can resize or rotate accessories to fit them. If our selection isn't enough for you, you can even draw your own accessories and sell them in a marketplace for others to purchase!

Discover many hidden secrets of Kasaria. Find clues in books, maps, or elsewhere and go treasure/knowledge hunting. There is a lot of land and treasure just waiting to be discovered!

Battle wild creatures or other enemies to earn monster drops. Monster drops may be clothing, food, or other trinkets that can aid you through your travels.

Play games, complete different types of quests, and interact with your companion! Or if you just want something relaxing to do, gather some bait and choose from a selection of spots to fish at. Currently, we have over 20 games!

Communicate with other explorers through a shoutbox, private messages, or the forum! NPCs (non-player characters) may even make guest appearances.

Of course we have a bounty of rewards to share with those who help out! In addition to the prize packs, all backers will be put on a honors wall that will remain on the site forever as our way of saying thanks!

Everything is EXCLUSIVE unless otherwise stated.

**GREEN DEALS - GET THEM WHILE THEY LAST**
((short quick deals in limited quantity in order to help reach our goal! Keep an eye out on our social media sites to be notified when these deals are posted))

*Restrictions: Provide a theme (ex: constellation, woodland, slime, etc) and our artists will take care of the rest! Initial concept sketches will be provided for your approval. Note - we will not accept themes that do not fit the Kasaria universe , or may be considered offensive to others. (No Earth-based holidays, cultures, copyrighted material, or other ideals - but animals or plants may be referenced. Also nothing that may be considered beyond something "realistic" for a planet. Some companion types may include accessories, but they should be kept to an absolute minimum.)


Feel free to ask questions about what may or may not be accepted, but there is only one slot available! Should you purchase this perk and have your idea rejected, you are free to provide other ideas! We're happy to work with you for as much as necessary to make you happy :)

*Choose from a list of companion or human NPCs to name!
Restrictions: No blatant copyrighted names (Spongebob),
no offensive or inappropriate names. While not many NPCs
are named, duplicates are not allowed, and names still need
to fit in the Kasa universe (like no "Watermelon",
"Wolfeschlegelsteinhausenbergerdorff"")


*Supply a photo reference and some likes that would best represent
your pet. We will work with you to create an item that looks like your
pet or has its picture on it!
The item's description will include 'In loving memory of (pet name)'.
Limit 10.


-----


*Tinctures are NOT exclusive but are a bit more difficult to get.


*$5 in gems, the cash shop currency.


*Twaog totems can be bought in the cash shop for $10 and can be
used or sold/traded to other users at any time.


Real life merchandise! (Clarification: If the $1,000
perk to design a companion is bought, then the new
companion will be included in the button set, making
a total of 15 buttons)
Button diameter is 2 1/4" (inches).


Now with $10 worth of gems instead of $5! Hiikapin cannot be adopted normally or bought, and their totems may only be given out during special events to a small amount of players.

Real life merchandise! (Will also include a button of the
new companion if that perk is bought, bringing the total
to 21 buttons.)
Button diameter is 2 1/4" (inches).

*Make a weapon, food item, toy, or even book (you provide a prompt and what the book cover should look like) unique to Kasaria! 
Get three copies of your item. This item will be available for other players too.

Restrictions:  Cannot be a companion color/type changer, cannot be based off of copyrighted material, and must fit the Kasaria universe (technology is allowed to an extent!).
Further restrictions may apply.
Don't hesitate to ask about an item idea first if you
are considering buying this perk! :)


*[Click for larger poster image]

*Make a clothing item or background for either Human Avatars (clothes, tattoos, hair styles, extra body parts, etc!) or for companions. Companion accessories can either be general (like a bow tie) or they could be species/type specific (like a saddle with a plushie sitting on it for a mutant celekin).
Get three copies of your item. This item will be available for other players too.

Restrictions:  If for a companion, it must be for an existing species and color/type, cannot be based off of copyrighted material, must fit within the limitations of the canvas size (can't be a huge spaceship unless it's partially cropped!) and must fit the Kasaria universe (technology is allowed to an extent!). 
Further restrictions may apply.
Don't hesitate to ask about an item idea first if you 
are considering buying this perk! :)

*Make a pal design, which comes with an alternate coloration and small lineart change. (So there could be like opposite elemental colorations like light/shadow or just whatever you want!) 

Get three copies of both colorations of your pal. 
This pal will be available for other players too.

Restrictions: Pals cannot be based off of copyrighted material,
cannot too closely resemble companions and must fit the Kasaria universe (technological pals are allowed).
Further restrictions may apply.
Don't hesitate to ask about a pal idea first if you 
are considering buying this perk! :)


(Signed poster from the lovely admins of Kasa. Why *wouldn't* you want that?)


All restrictions from the other design-packs apply.
Don't hesitate to ask about a companion idea first if you 
are considering buying this perk! :)

If we meet our goal of $3,000 and go BEYOND that, we have even greater prizes for everyone involved!

$4,000 - An extensive lore library will be ready before release, and a new companion type for all Companions - A poll will be provided to see which one is wanted more. All backers will receive one type changer for the new type.
$5,000 - New mini-explore area will be unlockable upon release and Albino and Melanistic companion type will be created, and all backers will receive one of the potions to change a companion into these at random.
$6,000 - Loads of more games, quests, and a new part of the map to explore will be available upon release!

Although Kasaria already has some programming and art created to generally cover "the basics", we still have loads of ideas that we want to implement before Kasaria's release! And a fundraiser will help those ideas come alive much sooner.

A majority of the funds will go towards programming more features. Money will also be set aside for servers, so that Kasaria will be able to handle many users online at once. And a fraction will be spent on aesthetics for the site, from NPC images to game graphics and more.

The Kasaria team has been working very hard to create an enjoyable pet site. One that feels more like a game, where you can easily spend hours on and still have fresh content available for the next day. We believe that Kasaria will be a success, and we hope that you can become a part of its early stages!

If you have any additional questions, feel free to ask!


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any spare change to help fund Kasaria? Don't worry - you can still help!

  • Tell all of your friends and family all about it! Like, reblog, follow, or favorite things from Kasaria's various social media sites.
  • Wait for Grand Opening. If you can't join Kasaria early on, that's okay~ We'd love to see you on Grand Opening day! :D

+++There will be daily updates on our social media sites, but please share this campaign with others too :D !+++
story_txt:
Kasaria is an upcoming virtual pet site / rpg mix! Players partner up with a companion, which will help you settle into Kasaria to explore, battle, and more. The more time you spend with your companions, the quicker they'll learn English so that they can communicate more easily with you. Of course, the alternative is that you could learn their language instead!Involve yourself with your Human Avatar. Dress up to your heart's content and level it up through a variety of tasks to explore further areas of Kasaria.Customize your companion too with many accessories! All companions (apart from the basic colors) have unique poses, so you can resize or rotate accessories to fit them. If our selection isn't enough for you, you can even draw your own accessories and sell them in a marketplace for others to purchase!Discover many hidden secrets of Kasaria. Find clues in books, maps, or elsewhere and go treasure/knowledge hunting. There is a lot of land and treasure just waiting to be discovered!Battle wild creatures or other enemies to earn monster drops. Monster drops may be clothing, food, or other trinkets that can aid you through your travels.Play games, complete different types of quests, and interact with your companion! Or if you just want something relaxing to do, gather some bait and choose from a selection of spots to fish at. Currently, we have over 20 games!Communicate with other explorers through a shoutbox, private messages, or the forum! NPCs (non-player characters) may even make guest appearances.Of course we have a bounty of rewards to share with those who help out! In addition to the prize packs, all backers will be put on a honors wall that will remain on the site forever as our way of saying thanks!Everything is EXCLUSIVE unless otherwise stated.**GREEN DEALS - GET THEM WHILE THEY LAST**((short quick deals in limited quantity in order to help reach our goal! Keep an eye out on our social media sites to be notified when these deals are posted))*Restrictions: Provide a theme (ex: constellation, woodland, slime, etc) and our artists will take care of the rest! Initial concept sketches will be provided for your approval. Note - we will not accept themes that do not fit the Kasaria universe , or may be considered offensive to others. (No Earth-based holidays, cultures, copyrighted material, or other ideals - but animals or plants may be referenced. Also nothing that may be considered beyond something "realistic" for a planet. Some companion types may include accessories, but they should be kept to an absolute minimum.)Feel free to ask questions about what may or may not be accepted, but there is only one slot available! Should you purchase this perk and have your idea rejected, you are free to provide other ideas! We're happy to work with you for as much as necessary to make you happy :)*Choose from a list of companion or human NPCs to name! Restrictions: No blatant copyrighted names (Spongebob),no offensive or inappropriate names. While not many NPCsare named, duplicates are not allowed, and names still needto fit in the Kasa universe (like no "Watermelon", "Wolfeschlegelsteinhausenbergerdorff"")*Supply a photo reference and some likes that would best represent your pet. We will work with you to create an item that looks like your pet or has its picture on it!The item's description will include 'In loving memory of (pet name)'.Limit 10.-----*Tinctures are NOT exclusive but are a bit more difficult to get.*$5 in gems, the cash shop currency.*Twaog totems can be bought in the cash shop for $10 and can beused or sold/traded to other users at any time.Real life merchandise! (Clarification: If the $1,000 perk to design a companion is bought, then the new companion will be included in the button set, making a total of 15 buttons)Button diameter is 2 1/4" (inches).Now with $10 worth of gems instead of $5! Hiikapin cannot be adopted normally or bought, and their totems may only be given out during special events to a small amount of players.Real life merchandise! (Will also include a button of thenew companion if that perk is bought, bringing the totalto 21 buttons.)Button diameter is 2 1/4" (inches).*Make a weapon, food item, toy, or even book (you provide a prompt and what the book cover should look like) unique to Kasaria! Get three copies of your item. This item will be available for other players too.Restrictions:  Cannot be a companion color/type changer, cannot be based off of copyrighted material, and must fit the Kasaria universe (technology is allowed to an extent!).Further restrictions may apply.Don't hesitate to ask about an item idea first if youare considering buying this perk! :)*[Click for larger poster image]*Make a clothing item or background for either Human Avatars (clothes, tattoos, hair styles, extra body parts, etc!) or for companions. Companion accessories can either be general (like a bow tie) or they could be species/type specific (like a saddle with a plushie sitting on it for a mutant celekin).Get three copies of your item. This item will be available for other players too.Restrictions:  If for a companion, it must be for an existing species and color/type, cannot be based off of copyrighted material, must fit within the limitations of the canvas size (can't be a huge spaceship unless it's partially cropped!) and must fit the Kasaria universe (technology is allowed to an extent!). Further restrictions may apply.Don't hesitate to ask about an item idea first if you are considering buying this perk! :)*Make a pal design, which comes with an alternate coloration and small lineart change. (So there could be like opposite elemental colorations like light/shadow or just whatever you want!) Get three copies of both colorations of your pal. This pal will be available for other players too.Restrictions: Pals cannot be based off of copyrighted material, cannot too closely resemble companions and must fit the Kasaria universe (technological pals are allowed).Further restrictions may apply.Don't hesitate to ask about a pal idea first if you are considering buying this perk! :)(Signed poster from the lovely admins of Kasa. Why *wouldn't* you want that?)All restrictions from the other design-packs apply.Don't hesitate to ask about a companion idea first if you are considering buying this perk! :)If we meet our goal of $3,000 and go BEYOND that, we have even greater prizes for everyone involved!$4,000 - An extensive lore library will be ready before release, and a new companion type for all Companions - A poll will be provided to see which one is wanted more. All backers will receive one type changer for the new type.$5,000 - New mini-explore area will be unlockable upon release and Albino and Melanistic companion type will be created, and all backers will receive one of the potions to change a companion into these at random.$6,000 - Loads of more games, quests, and a new part of the map to explore will be available upon release!Although Kasaria already has some programming and art created to generally cover "the basics", we still have loads of ideas that we want to implement before Kasaria's release! And a fundraiser will help those ideas come alive much sooner.A majority of the funds will go towards programming more features. Money will also be set aside for servers, so that Kasaria will be able to handle many users online at once. And a fraction will be spent on aesthetics for the site, from NPC images to game graphics and more.The Kasaria team has been working very hard to create an enjoyable pet site. One that feels more like a game, where you can easily spend hours on and still have fresh content available for the next day. We believe that Kasaria will be a success, and we hope that you can become a part of its early stages!If you have any additional questions, feel free to ask!Other Ways You Can HelpDon't have any spare change to help fund Kasaria? Don't worry - you can still help!

story:
Help "SUNK!" become the winner of Hasbro's "Next Great Game Challenge!"


The Game:

SUNK! is a social skill and action game requiring a steady hand, impenetrable concentration, and sharp wits combined with an appetite for suspense and intense laughter.  SUNK!:
  • Social Game with tons of interaction
  • Skill is required to pour carefully while performing silly stunts
  • Sabotage is fully encouraged!  Can I screw up my opponents by pushing my turn to the limit?
Geared to anyone from ages 5 and up (how about an adult version??), the goal of the game is to add water to the cup without causing it to sink. Seem simple enough?  Can you pour 1 drop while hopping on one leg or 2 drops with one eye closed??  What if the base starts shaking?? (See our alternate versions below!) The stress of performing silly stunts, combined with the "strategy" of sabotaging your opponents with aggressive pours, and now you have yourself a challenge! Hilarity ensues around the table with all players laughing and waiting for the next round to begin.  Feeling confident? Good luck!



Object:

Don’t sink the cup!! Steady yourself, pour, but beware of taunting and distracting opponents, as breaking YOUR concentration is a surefire way for the other players to survive in this game. A player is eliminated once they have sunk the Float Cup in the Sunk Tank, thus removing them from the rotation of the game. The remaining players will empty the Float Cup and continue the rotation with the other participants. This rotation will continue until there is only one player remaining. The final remaining player is the winner of the game and SUNK champion!

Full Game set includes:  SUNK! Tank, Float cup, special die, and over 100 challenge cards

Challenge Cards and Dice

A few examples of the coated challenge cards (Currently over 100 Available):
  • Hop on one foot while pouring 2 drops
  • Pour 3 drops with your opposite hand
  • Pant like a dog while pouring 2 drops
  • Blank cards included so you can come up with your own party challenges!

Depending on the roll of the die, you may have to:
  • Pour 1 drop
  • Pour 2 drops
  • Pour 3 drops
  • Reverse (R)- Play switches directions
  • Skip (X) - Skip your current turn and pass your turn to next player
  • Challenge (C) - Take your chances and pick a challenge card


******WARNING---Good Times Ahead---Adults Only****** Having a party?  Grab your friends, a drink and try a different way to play!  You know what we mean ;-) so be sure you have our personalized SUNK! shot glasses (see perks below) handy when it's time to play!  Could you even fill the SUNK! tank with a special beverage?  The possibilities are endless and we promise we won't tell.


****Exciting new development**** We are currently experimenting with upping the ante on the game and are testing the SUNK game with a "Vibrating" base! Now, if you lose your concentration and touch the Sunk tank while pouring, you will cause the base to vibrate, almost sealing your fate as the player who sinks the cup!  This option would be sold as an additional base that could be used in conjunction with your original game.  Stay tuned for updates!


Who Are We and Why Are We Doing This?

What are three average guys from neighboring small towns in Massachusetts doing out here raising funds for a game?  Well we thought we had a great idea and came across Hasbro's Next Great Game Challenge and were hooked.  Of course we had those moments thinking "can we really win this thing?", but we were so confident and had so much fun playing our game, we had to give it a try.  So over the next 45 days (yes, only 45 days!) we became extremely busy.  Let us tell you about our journey.

During the first 2 weeks, we developed a functional prototype, created, designed, and printed our challenge cards, die, SUNK tank, and base.  We burned through many, many versions of each before submitting our idea into the Hasbro challenge.  2 weeks later, we were notified that we were selected as a top 5 finalist in the contest.  Wait what??  We were pretty excited to say the least, but now the real work had to begin.  

With 15 days remaining to prepare this crowdfunding campaign we still had a lot of work to do. We needed to make this product viable and polished.  15 days of hard work and late nights have brought us to this point and to the product you see today. We love what SUNK has become and are looking forward to the steps ahead.   The next phase of our project includes sitting down with manufacturers and producing a store shelf version of the game.   Please join us on this journey by following us, spreading the word, and contributing to our campaign.  Be a part of the "The Next Great Game"!  

So who are we???

  • Scott Jackson- Mild mannered banker by day, married with one 12 yr old daughter
  • Bill Bellan-  Landscape Design Project Manager, married with a 7 yr old son and 10 yr old daughter
  • Scott Ruth- Member of a fantastic manufacturing team married with a 14 yr old son, a 12 yr old son, and an 8 yr old daughter


How we got here

Well, we think we are like most families in that we work long and hard during the week, spend time supporting our kids in all of their activities, and have very little free time to sit down and enjoy ourselves.  When we have that time, it is very common to find everyone in the family on some type of electronic device (how annoying!).   

On random Saturday nights over the past year, we found ourselves getting together and looking for ways to have a bit of fun in order to recharge.  One of those ways was playing various games, which is where SUNK originated.  We created this game and soon realized we would play for hours on end and the laughter never stopped. It didn't take long for the kids to realize how much fun we were having and they'd soon be looking over our shoulders wanting to play too.  AHA!!  What if we adapted this game to make it even more fun AND include our kids?  The answer is here!  We are so excited to bring face to face family fun back to our homes.  Put down the phones and laptops and get SUNK!


What We Need & What You Get

We think this game will help bring people of all ages together....To help us bring this game to you, we are going to need enough resources to do so.  

  • We are looking to raise a total of $10,000 to help us pursue the idea and get this game on store shelves in your area
  • To encourage your participation in our campaign, please see below for our special incentives

Contribution Perks!


One additional perk to tell you about!  Only 10 available!  Be the first to bring SUNK to the party!  Get  yourself a first edition, handmade, serial numbered, and personally signed prototype of the next great game.  Own a piece of history as these will never be made again!

Other Ways You Can Help  

We totally understand that every dollar counts in today's economy, so if you find yourself in a position where you would love to support us in a non-monetary fashion, you can:

  • Ask your friends and family to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use of social media is highly encouraged!   

                                                      

  • Share our site using the handy share tools on this page or the link below!
http://igg.me/at/sunk

That's all there is to it!  Thank you!

story:
The Invitation......

The year is 2017.

Several infectious diseases ravage the earth and despite much human effort, the infections continue to spread.

Those most affected live in areas of poverty and conflict with limited access to useful intel, treatment and items of immunity.

The war has been long. Many lives have been lost.

Great warriors of the past have triumphed in landmark victories such as Jonas Salk at the battle of Iron Lung and Edward Jenner’s rescue of the Milk Maiden, all In the quest for the golden key of herd immunity.

Battles, however, continue to be lost in the trenches.

It has become clear that the responsibility of success falls on the foot soldiers.

Triumph depends on the education of the populace.

To aid, an innovative tool has emerged.

In the aim to combat the spread of virus and bacteria, a select few have been chosen to distribute key intel on the infections.

This information has been contained within a game.

The aim, to distribute information on features of symptoms and statistics of the target diseases.

Designed to be addictively fun, hopefully increasing uptake of the game, especially in areas that education and reward for playing the most. If you are receiving this message, you are invited to become a player.

One of the first to implement gaming on the front line.

Collect the cards, battle the symptoms and statistics, spread intel this way.

Play for fun, but remember, its more than just a game.

Good luck, foot soldier....

Join the herd.

The following is an instructional transcript of the game.

<<<<<MESSAGE BEGINS>>>>>>>

'''Vaxcards'''  is a game of infectious disease and fun.

A strategic battle style card game where players collect diseases to infect and eradicate each other.

The game is played with a hit point system, aiming to lower your opponents resistance to zero.

The fun, lovable characters are based on the childhood, adult and traveler vaccination program.

Illustration and game mechanics are built around symptoms and statistics from real diseases.

The game has three settings of complexity, for normal humans, younger humans and advanced game humans.

The collectable character cards have the potential to be integrated as a reward for vaccination against that specific disease for children nervous of needles.

As you progress through the schedule, more playable characters and game options unlock.

The game can also be enjoyed by any science or tabletop game lover, with innovative concept, robust game mechanics and quirky fun quick game play.

Welcome to the herd, player.

<<<<MESSAGE END>>>>

 

BULK ORDERS AND RETAILERS...

Pleasing contact Dan + Adam   email@vaxcards.com

 

CURRENT UNLOCKED CARDS

Starter deck: Childhood immunization schedule diseases

booster deck: booster diseases in the immunization schedule used for reward of vaccination (get a vaccine, get a card....parent / school initiated)

Tropical deck: Tropical diseases, immunizations for travelers and people in endemic areas

UNLOCKED DECKS!

Future deck: Targeted diseases for future vaccination development, huge impact diseases for global health

Eradication deck: eradicated or nearly eradicated preventable diseases

 

UNLOCKED CHARACTER ILLUSTRATION EXPLOSION

explaining the disease symptoms Easter-Egged into the design.

Explainer video

 



Game play

 

Game Review

 

Stretch goals

Use the following list to work out how to unlock each exploded pictorial character bio!

complete 10 achievements to unlock ......The Eradication deck UNLOCKED

 campaign 150% funded to unlock ...........The Future Deck UNLOCKED!

 complete 15 achievements to unlock.......Eradication Characters

complete 20 achievements to unlock....... ?

*FOR PHOTO ACHIEVEMENTS, SUBMIT TO THE FACEBOOK PAGE BY TAGGING US IN YOUR PHOTO

 

Facebook

Twitter @vaxcards

www.vaxcards.com

 

The Story

Adam and Dan became friends during university through playing sport and continued a friendship with love of board games and burritos.

After many conversations about one day creating a board game they decided to have a go at something innovative.

Inspired by working as a doctor, Dan came to Adam with the initial Vaxcards idea. The aim was to create a game that we enjoyed playing, while at the same time it could serve a greater purpose by providing foremost an education and reward system for vaccination.

However, it was crucial for us to create a game worth playing for adults as well. It was key to have good character design, game mechanics and aesthetics that were build to maximize the fun value. and through many hours of discussion and play testing they are very excited to release this innovative game.

Help us build it and join the herd.

During this launch, we are providing backers with the chance to receive the full vaxcards set. In the future, we plan to translate this to many languages and hopefully distribute alongside vaccination programs that need the education and reward for vaccination the most. We also wish to create expansions into other fields of medicine for gamifying education on other topics.

So we are currently building a funding model that will allow us in phase two after our launch to widely distribute core components of the game to focused areas requiring education. That is part of the decision to release the starer deck of our print and play for FREE on our website whilst providing some very bulk size backing tiers, for those out there who want to really kick start our idea.

For now, we are just a couple of board game loving guys who are trying to help solve one piece of a big problem in a fun way and crowd funding provides us with the perfect platform to reach others who are passionate about science, games, education and working towards bigger things.

REWARDS

click for free starter deck here!

RULES

used for reward of vaccination (get a vaccine, get a card....parent / school initiated)Tropical deck: Tropical diseases, immunizations for travelers and people in endemic areasUNLOCKED DECKS!Future deck: Targeted diseases for future vaccination development, huge impact diseases for global healthEradication deck: eradicated or nearly eradicated preventable diseases UNLOCKED CHARACTER ILLUSTRATION EXPLOSIONexplaining the disease symptoms Easter-Egged into the design.Explainer video Game play

 
Game Review

 
Stretch goalsUse the following list to work out how to unlock each exploded pictorial character bio!complete 10 achievements to unlock ......The Eradication deck UNLOCKED campaign 150% funded to unlock ...........The Future Deck UNLOCKED! complete 15 achievements to unlock.......Eradication Characterscomplete 20 achievements to unlock....... ?*FOR PHOTO ACHIEVEMENTS, SUBMIT TO THE FACEBOOK PAGE BY TAGGING US IN YOUR PHOTO FacebookTwitter @vaxcardswww.vaxcards.com The StoryAdam and Dan became friends during university through playing sport and continued a friendship with love of board games and burritos.After many conversations about one day creating a board game they decided to have a go at something innovative.Inspired by working as a doctor, Dan came to Adam with the initial Vaxcards idea. The aim was to create a game that we enjoyed playing, while at the same time it could serve a greater purpose by providing foremost an education and reward system for vaccination.However, it was crucial for us to create a game worth playing for adults as well. It was key to have good character design, game mechanics and aesthetics that were build to maximize the fun value. and through many hours of discussion and play testing they are very excited to release this innovative game.Help us build it and join the herd.During this launch, we are providing backers with the chance to receive the full vaxcards set. In the future, we plan to translate this to many languages and hopefully distribute alongside vaccination programs that need the education and reward for vaccination the most. We also wish to create expansions into other fields of medicine for gamifying education on other topics.So we are currently building a funding model that will allow us in phase two after our launch to widely distribute core components of the game to focused areas requiring education. That is part of the decision to release the starer deck of our print and play for FREE on our website whilst providing some very bulk size backing tiers, for those out there who want to really kick start our idea.For now, we are just a couple of board game loving guys who are trying to help solve one piece of a big problem in a fun way and crowd funding provides us with the perfect platform to reach others who are passionate about science, games, education and working towards bigger things.REWARDSclick for free starter deck here!RULES

story:
Introduction

High, my name is Aaron Reno (aka Bud S. Moker, Th.C.) from SmokingWithStyle.com. Me and my team are attempting to raise $997 to launch our game Highjack. The money will be used to order game decks, countertop display boxes, and limited edition posters.

Highjack! Coming to a Session Near You!

Highjack is a “highly” strategic cannabis-powered card game. Each player (aka “Toker”) draws 1 card and plays 1 card. The first Toker to collect all of their Stash Box cards and at least one Session card wins the round. The game is over when a Toker reaches—you guessed it—420 points!

Highjack Card Artwork

Highjack has the best art of any/all cannabis-themed games I have ever seen ... if I do say so myself. But don't take my word for it, check out these 3 examples:

About the Game: What is Highjack?

Highjack is the perfect combination of action, strategy, and marijuana humor. While the game will be fun for everyone, it is especially “cool” for those who partake of the great herb. Imagine the best of War, Uno, and Rummy and you’ll have an idea about how the game is played.

Following is a step-by-step guide to playing Highjack: The Game Everyone's Tokin' About!


Thank You for Your Support!

We wanted to put this project on Indiegogo because it's the fastest way for us to get the game into your hands and make improvements as a community. We think this game is great, but we need your help making it even better.

So, if a world full of "cool" people who play games and partake in the great wonders of Mother Nature is a world you would like to make a reality, please back this project and help us build the game.

What if We Don't Reach Our Goal?

Regardless of funding, we will be finishing the creation of our game this year. In fact, the production of the cards (and tuck boxes) has already begun.

Toke to ya soon,

Aaron

story:
IndieGoGo does not allow modification to your pledge and charges you upon pledging. Refunds are only given on projects which do not fund; there is no "oh I changed my mind" mechanism on this site and the campaign organizers (LotFP in this case) have no control or access to such things. "Overflow" from one project cannot be transferred to another. Consider your choice to contribute carefully and be sure you mean it before you hit that payment button.

If you contribute and it doesn't fund, YOU GET IT FOR FREE ANYWAY! (PDF at $10+ contribution, print at $20+) See the July 22 update for full details.

July 23 Update: $30+ contributions get a 16 page sandbox setting by Rob S Conley (Majestic Wilderlands, Points of Light 1 & 2, etc.) in print + pdf as an added Extra. Not to be released in any form outside these campaigns. Grab Bag contributions get to choose their adventures (up to 6). $160+ get an exclusive 64 page James Edward Raggi IV LotFP adventure. Not offered in this form outside these campaigns.  See the Updates tab for full details.

Lamentations of the Flame Princess presents Horror Among Thieves by Kelvin Green

"The Tenebrous Hand don't rule the city, but they may as well. If they can't bribe you, they can sneak into your home and threaten you and yours. That's why they get away with it. But you know what I think’s fishy? No one's seen one of their men for a while. No one's been collecting the protection money and I've got this constable mate who says that there aren't so many robberies these days. I’ll tell you another thing: he also says that the people in charge are more worried than ever, because if a thief's going through your pockets, you at least know where he is, you know what I mean? And you’ve got to wonder, if the Hand really are gone, then what’s happened to all their loot?"

About the Author
Kelvin Green is a regular artist for both the comic series Too Much Sex & Violence and the old school roleplaying magazine Fight On! He has also drawn all sorts of gribbly things for The Girly Comic, The B/X Companion, The O Men, PJANG! and the upcoming Petty Gods and Dwimmermount Codex. As a writer he has contributed to NintendoLife, has been a regular at Comics Bulletin for years, created the Call of Cthulhu scenario "Dinner With Susan" and was one of the winners in both the 2011 and 2012 One Page Dungeon contests, despite not submitting a proper dungeon either time. His favourite roleplaying game is Call of Cthulhu. Or maybe Pendragon. Or Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay. Kelvin lurks in Brighton on England's allegedly sunny south coast, waiting for a chance to backstab a seagull for triple damage.

http://junkopia.net/kelvinsdirtybits/index.html
http://brightonandhoveroleplayers.blogspot.co.uk/

About LotFP
LotFP is the publisher of Weird Fantasy Role-Playing, a horror-fantasy tabletop RPG. It is a second-generation retro-clone, which means that adventures compatible with LotFP are also compatible with over a dozen different games. A free no-art PDF version of the LotFP rulebook is available here. For more info hit the LotFP home page or LotFP blog.

This is one of a number of concurrent campaigns underway to get adventures by top talent published for LotFP. The full list:

Escaping Leviathan by Aeron Alfrey
The Seclusium of Orphone by Vincent Baker and Cynthia Sheppard FUNDED
Strange and Sinister Shores by Johnathan Bingham
Towers Two by Dave Brockie
The Unbegotten Citadel by Monte Cook and Eric Lofgren
The House of Bone and Amber by Kevin Crawford and Earl Geier
Of Unknown Provenance by Michael Curtis and Amos Orion Sterns
Machinations of the Space Princess by James Desborough and Satine Phoenix
Horror Among Thieves by Kelvin Green
We Who Are Lost by Anna Kreider
The Land that Exuded Evil by Cynthia Celeste Miller and Rowena Aitken
Pyre by Richard Pett and Michael Syrigos
I Hate Myself For What I Must Do by Mike Pohjola and Joel Sammallahti
Broodmother Sky Fortress by Jeff Rients and Stuart Robertson FUNDED
Normal for Norfolk by Juhani Seppälä and Rich Longmore
Poor Blighters by Jeff & Joel Sparks and Mark Allen
The Depths of Paranoia by Jennifer Steen and Jason Rainville
Red in Beak and Claw by Jukka Särkijärvi and Jason Rainville
The Dreaming Plague by Ville Vuorela and Juha Makkonen

For more information about this series of campaigns, to discuss contribution strategies, ask questions, or to simply comment about this madness, go to the message board for this campaign series here.

About the Campaigns

The "Extras" aka "What I Would Do With This" sheets are each a single A5 sheet written by James Edward Raggi IV advising how he would change an adventure to give it a different sort of twist or fit into his own campaign.

There are risks for choosing bundle options - if the project you chose the bundle options on does not fund, you'd end up with nothing. If fewer than expected adventures fund, you're paying more than you would have by contributing to each adventure individually. Be aware of how you are contributing and what cost/benefit ratio you're willing to risk.

The perks above the single adventure levels are leaps of faith representing a desire to help get things funded and a hope of a better deal - but this is crowdfunding, we cannot guarantee results.

What is the Pembrooktonshire Gardening Society?

That's the LotFP Fan and Discount club. It costs 10€ to join (+23% VAT for EU orders), and you get a 1€ discount on all print products in the LotFP store forever. Sometimes other benefits too, like saving $50 on an exclusive hardcover set in these campaigns. Details on joining the Society here.

Where Does the Money Go?

Two-thirds of the money goes to the talent working on the project: The writer, artist, graphic designer, editor. The rest goes towards printing and shipping (and IndieGoGo's fees). The exact figure varies depending on how many of which perks are chosen, but LotFP will not begin making money on these projects until they hit $7000. LotFP's profits will (hopefully) come after the adventures are released and you all start raving about how cool the adventures are so the non-hardcore supporters go for them.

Other Notes

July 10 Update:
(see the July 10 entry in the Updates tab for more info on these points)
All funded adventures will include a PDF supplement with conversions to the "OGL 3.PF" rules system.
A new funding level has been added: The 3.PF Faithful, with all these conversion notes and stats included in their own booklet
New perks and information for The Faithful and Collecting Faithful levels:

  • If you go in for The Faithful level or above, and that adventure is the only one that funds, you will receive a 100€ coupon for the LotFP store. If only that and one other funds, you will receive a 50€ coupon.
  • An exclusive 64 page adventure by James Edward Raggi IV. This adventure will never again be printed in this format (only an abridged 32 or 48 page version in the future), only those pledging at the Faithful or Collecting Faithful levels on funded adventures will receive it. There will be no PDF version of this adventure. This adventure does not count against the ones mentioned in the previous bullet point. It will be included in your Collecting Faithful package but will not be a hardcover inside the slipcase.
  • A booklet with all of the "How I Would Fit This Into My Campaign" sheets, with cover art by Zak S (Vornheim, Playing D&D With Porn Stars, etc), will be included with these perks (will not be made as a hardcover for the slipcase).

For the Grab Bags, you may choose which adventures you want.
A new perk: "Retail Support" has been added
Three random Collector-level contributors on funded projects will get to have a character of their choice drawn by Jez Gordon in a situation from a funded adventure of their choice, with this art appearing in the Extras booklet.
(end July 10 Update)

It is our intention to go to press in late November/early December. However, with a potential 19 authors and 18 artists involved, someone is likely to be late so the adventures may not ship out until the new year.

Some of the adventures in these campaigns will be for ages 18+ because of (im)mature content, so be aware of that before contributing to any adventures or multi-adventure perks. If you want to double-check whether any individual adventure will be an 18+ affair, leave a note in the comments and we'll get back to you shortly.

Adventure titles are all subject to change although I'll roast the authors' bits if they turn in something ridiculously different than their supplied description.

All prices include first class shipping from Finland, or a tracked parcel if your stuff comes out to over 1kg.

Each adventure is scheduled to be an A5 sized 32 page book and would retail for 10€-13€ ($13.00-$16.00 depending on exchange rates) not including taxes or shipping. The $20 single copy purchase price is the best approximation of the price including first class shipping worldwide but the real amount may or may not match that. Some adventures, depending on the adventure structures, may be more than 32 pages.

Each funded adventure will have a full print run done for distribution.

The author of a funded adventure will get 10% of all money raised above the $7000 mark, and the artist will get 5% of all money raised above that amount, in addition to their agreed-on fees. Additional profits go into the LotFP war chest.

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys, I am Gabriel. I am currently a young student and about 30 days ago, I got a free trial for a program called Unity. Unity allows you to develop video games and while I have had some previous experience with the program, so I decided to try and use those 30 days of free trialing to develop a game for iOS devices. I got really into it, and before you know it, BAM! My trial ended! I can no longer work on the game. All hopes were lost! But, wait, I smell, help! And here you are reading my Indiegogo project! The game that I am working is called Rollé (Pronounced: Roll -ay). The game is a marble rolling game, where you roll the ball through a series of challenging obstable courses. The thing that I think makes this game different from other games is not only the courses and the art, but the fact that it uses virtual joysticks on the iOS device, which makes things easiar to control. I do plan on supporting accelerometer in the future. 

What I Need & What You Get

So the basic license fee for Unity iOS is $400. I am asking for $500 simply because that is the minimum. The money will go directly into paying for the license so I can get right back into development. After recieving and then purchasing the license, I will continue testing a development and send my contributors several copies of the game. If you contribute enough, you can even design your own level to appear on the release version of the game. Contributors will also recieve the game with customs level (And optionally, a custom ball character)

 

 

The Impact

You'll be helping a kid make his hopes come true, and getting some good in return! 

If you would like, I have included a link to try desktop versions of the un completed game. Thank you very much for taking a look at my project!

 

P.S. You can download an alpha copy of the game for Windows/Mac computers at 

http://galiro.com/rollegame
