Then join me and make Might & Fealty a reality. Spread the word and support my crowdfunding. Check for the cool perks I have lined up and decide upon your level of contribution.
Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Mendenbarr! Those of you who recognize my name will know me from the theorycrafting work I do for death knights for World of Warcraft. 

I've always loved games of any type, and WoW has been a huge part of my life for the past 8 years. Blizzcon is the WoW convention, and I've always wanted to attend, but I've never had the means to. So, this year I'd like to go to Blizzcon! 


What I Need & What You Get

I need about ~$1000 to pay for my coach class airfare, my ticket, and a few snacks along the way, and pay for a portion of a hotel room. I remain hopeful I'll be able to find someone to share a hotel room with.

If you have a hotel room/place that has room on the floor for me and my sleeping bag and isn't that far from the convention center, I'm very interested in purchasing it. 

If you have a spare blizzcon ticket, I'm also very interested in purchasing it. 


To be 100% clear, the successfulness of this will have no impact on my theorycrafting whatsoever. While I'll be a little sad if it fails, I'll continue devoting the same time and effort into producing useful information for all of you. I was thinking about several ideas for perks for contributors:

Access to all my theorycrafting work: It's already freely available on my blog, and will stay that way as long as I keep doing it. 

1 on 1 help with your death knight: I already give this out freely to any who ask. 

Answering any dk related questions: Already do this on both MMOC and EJ for free. 

So I've settled on a personal thank you to anyone who contributes, and the other benefits listed below. I'm also an indie game dev, and will be giving out free beta access to my games to contributors. If anyone has any suggestions for other perks I can often, I'm all ears. 

I've also set this campaign on fixed funding, so in the likely event I do not reach my goal, everyone will have all their money returned. 


Any amount over the goal will be saved for blizzcon next year.

story:
Description

Dear reader!

I'm happy that you found this project and are interested in backing it.

Mein Serverzentrum is a game like Prison Architect from Introversion. But here you don't build a prison. You build up your own "Serverplant".

But who are the dev's? Florian and Philipp.  One from Austria the other one from Germany. The idea was created by Philipp.

Why "Mein Serverzentrum"? Have you ever had an idea for a game and thought, "Oh man, I hope someone already did something like this!". Thats why Mein Serverzentrum was created. We wanted to have a  game like this so we created it!

This is where you come in.

  • We need 500€ or more. Why so much money for a little project like this?  
  • The other thing is, that we want to buy a Steam Greenlight license and thats expensive. And we have to buy some tools for creating the game. Also we need to drink and eat ;)
  • If you give us something, we want to give you something back.
  • If we don't reach our goal we will try to make it with less than 500€ but it will be hard.

The Effect...


  • Why is the project important? Because we think that somewhere out there, some players are sitting and waiting for a game likes this.
  • If you think we can't do that, you can visit our homepage, look at the videos and pictures or download a working prototype of the game.

You cant Donate?

No Problem, we don't hate you :). You can help too.  Just spread the word about this campaign.

story:
The Rhapsode

Ἡ Ῥαψωδή (The Rhapsode) is a single-player puzzle-based adventure RPG set in a "columnpunk" version of ancient Greece. Rhapsodes were employed by the Greeks to sing and recite the epics, primarily Homer's Iliad and Odyssey. Eupheme (Ἐύφημη), our hero, learns of a lost story from the Odyssey and, hoping to make a name for herself and expand the repertoire of rhapsodes everywhere, sets out in search of it - a search that leads her across Greece and deep into ruins ancient even to her.

 

Noëlle Anthony and Mischievess Studios

Noëlle Anthony, the creator of Ἡ Ῥαψωδή, has a long background both with games and with the classics. She programmed her first games from a Marvel Comics BASIC magazine at age 5, and has never stopped developing. Likewise, she began learning Latin in the 7th grade and earned a Bachelor's degree in Classical Studies in 2007 after more than a decade of immersion in the language and culture of ancient Greece and Rome.

Noëlle came out as a transgender woman in 2011, and has since founded Mischievess Studios, a game-development studio intended to give women a start in the game industry. It seemed like an obvious step to combine her loves - classical studies and game design and programming - into Ἡ Ῥαψωδή, the first game to be developed under the Mischievess banner.

Funding the development of this game will allow Mischievess Studios to pursue projects beyond Ἡ Ῥαψωδή, which in turn will allow Mischievess to begin and promote the careers of other women in game development and design. It's a small but significant step in equalizing the game industry.

Currently, Noëlle is the sole creative contributor to the project, but meeting stretch goals will change that!

 

Where will my contribution go?

The first $36,000 of this campaign will go toward allowing Noëlle to make this game her full-time job for one year; $9,000 will go toward making necessary infrastructure changes to the studio. (Specifically, this will allow the studio access to broadband internet - a necessity which, due to the studio's location in rural Maryland, is not yet available.)

If the primary goal is met, further contributions will be directed toward providing professional art and music for the game. Although Noëlle enjoys creating art and music, taking these off her plate will free her up to concentrate on story and programming.

Any contributions above $50,000 will be split evenly between art and music for Ἡ Ῥαψωδή. At $120,000, Mischievess Studios will attempt to retain art and music directors for the full year.

In addition, if this project reaches $100,000 in contributions, Mischievess Studios will add an ancient Greek language option to the game.

 

What does my contribution get me?

Everyone who contributes $10 or more will receive a copy of the game when it is released, as well as free updates for the life of the game. You will also be listed as a contributor in the game's credits.

Larger contributions carry larger rewards:

  • Multiple copies of the game (for friends!)
  • Alpha/beta access
  • Exclusive wallpapers and icons
  • The official Ἡ Ῥαψωδή soundtrack
  • Higher-status credit within the game
  • Access to exclusive in-game items
  • The ability to name an in-game NPC (within reason)

 

What if I can't contribute financially?

You can still help by spreading the word! Every single share, tweet, Facebook post, Tumbl, and blog post helps. And if you're a musician or artist who would be willing to contribute to Ἡ Ῥαψωδή, please drop us a line and let us know!

 

How do you pronounce Ἡ Ῥαψωδή?

Roughly: "hey rhah-psoh-DAY". (But nobody will be upset if you just call the game "The Rhapsode".)

How can I get in touch?

You can find Noëlle on Twitter as @noellejoyeuse, or send an email to noelle.d.anthony at Gmail. Noëlle will also be starting a podcast discussing the development process - watch this space for details!

story:
4.3.2013 - Nary an hour has passed, and already we have another Finnish sci-fi developer suggesting co-operation between our projects! We are anxious to see what tomorrow will bring!

12.3.2013 - We have shipping cost estimates outside Finland! These prices will be added to the perks Shareholder, VIP and Salvage Operator.

Finland - Free

Europe - $10

USA - $30 (Sorry for the inconvenience; Shipping is surprisingly expensive in the north!)

Relic Hunter will have free shipping!

28.3.2013 - Our designer has finally finished his other project, and is placing his full attention to Salvage Team! If you are interested in finding out more about Salvage Team, check out our design blog posts!

http://gamesandtales.com/blog/

 

12.4.2013 - We have launched a small competition for our fans and followers. If you want your favourite cat to be included in the game, see our website and participate! 
www.gamesandtales.com/contest

 

25.4.2013 - Our forums are now online! You can ask all your questions there! Remember that if you have contributed, you can use the same e-mail you used on Indiegogo.com to register as a VIP and get access to our VIP forum!
www.gamesandtales.com/forum

 

 

Many thanks to all of our contributors!
We will continue the production of the game and everyone who contributed will receive their perks as soon as they become available. You can continue following the development of the game at our forums. Thank you.
All Best Wishes,
Salvage Team Development Crew,
Games and Tales

 

 

 

 

Death Zones are gravitationally bound fields of wrecks and debris, remnants of furious space battles. They are filled with insane shipboard security systems, unexploded warheads and drifting pieces of jagged wreckage. But most importantly, valuable loot and unexpected treasures. That is where the Salvage Teams come in.

We are four grizzled game developers, hailing from the frozen ice planet of Finland. We navigate the perilous reaches of board game development in our rusty Deep Space Office Games&Tales. We have set our sensors to a board game project identified as Salvage Team, but we cannot bring you all the hard-earned fun alone. That is where this campaign and the Salvage Support Network come in.

Our purpose here in the IndieGoGo star system is to gather funds to execute our development plan for Salvage Team, and bring the exciting board game to you during the second half of 2013. You can contribute to this project by purchasing our perks with your earth dollars here in IndieGoGo, by joining the Salvage Support Network to get exclusive inside information on our game development, or by doing both.

To bring the game to the light of day, and the nearest board game shop to you, we need 8,000. This money will go to finalizing our graphical assets, tweaking the game mechanics, printing the games and making sure that our valued employees survive the harsh arctic conditions of our home planet.

Another way to support our expedition into the dark depths of board game design is to spread the word. Inform people in your social networks and cyberspace of our endeavour! Check out our portals at the bottom of the page, where you can direct interested people.

The Salvage Support Network is based in our exclusive cyberstation at gamesandtales.com. Contributors will have access to our discussion forum, where we will share development details.

Salvage Team will have an extremely modular, tile-based board. At the start of the game, a layer of face-down tiles forms the shape of the derelict ship. When the Salvagers delve in, new tiles are drawn face-up on top. The Salvagers will know what types of threats and loot the tiles will contain, but the exact details will only be revealed when the players stay put and face the dangers...

These images are work in progress, the final product might look different, most probably absolutely stunning.

Each character will have a large-sized card with a gorgeous illustration and a character advancement tile. You can build your team from generic, run of the mill Savvies, or big and expensive unique individuals and everything in between. With training tokens and special equipment you can tackle even more dangerous wrecks and bigger loot.

Since modularity and options are priceless artifacts, the Salvage Team experience will be widely customisable. You can play a single wreck in about an half an hour, or an ongoing campaign for the greatest profit and fame.

 

 

Should the campaign reach 10,000, we can add 2 unique, special characters from the Dreams of Altaine novels into the game! These high-salary loose cannons will change the balance of power... for good or for worse!

If we can reach 12,000, we can add Large Tiles to the game! Large Tiles are 2-by-1 special tiles, which contain even more valuable rewards and deadly threats. Since everyone knows what the tiles contain, the race will just get more furious.

And should the campaign hit 18,000, we will include an Event Deck into Salvage Team, bringing even more variety! With still-active defense cannons firing and random power fluctuations breathing life into the wreck, the Savvies will have to adapt or die.

We like co-operative board games, and for 30,000 we can promise you an expansion pack! Which will add rules for a story-based co-operative campaign, co-operative scenarios and heaps of components.

For 50,000 we can create Salvage Team Mobile, a smartphone and tablet computer app, which will enhance the board game experience! It will feature an augmented reality camera to bring the tiles into 3d, a digital Event Deck and an online stock market for the loot, among other things!

80,000 will be enough for us to upgrade Salvage Team Mobile with Grinder, a single-player game where you control the Furnace Shuttle! See if you can do better as a Rodent pilot than the basic AI! Procedural content and camera integration will make it possible to explore the same wreck both digitally and on the kitchen table!

If the stars align and we reach 500,000, we will realize our nostalgic hopes and create Salvage Team – The Digital Game! Fans of such old-school gems like UFO – Enemy Unknown and Space Hulk will undoubtedly be overjoyed of our endeavour!
story_txt:
4.3.2013 - Nary an hour has passed, and already we have another Finnish sci-fi developer suggesting co-operation between our projects! We are anxious to see what tomorrow will bring!
12.3.2013 - We have shipping cost estimates outside Finland! These prices will be added to the perks Shareholder, VIP and Salvage Operator.
Finland - Free
Europe - $10
USA - $30 (Sorry for the inconvenience; Shipping is surprisingly expensive in the north!)
Relic Hunter will have free shipping!
28.3.2013 - Our designer has finally finished his other project, and is placing his full attention to Salvage Team! If you are interested in finding out more about Salvage Team, check out our design blog posts!
http://gamesandtales.com/blog/
 
12.4.2013 - We have launched a small competition for our fans and followers. If you want your favourite cat to be included in the game, see our website and participate! www.gamesandtales.com/contest
 
25.4.2013 - Our forums are now online! You can ask all your questions there! Remember that if you have contributed, you can use the same e-mail you used on Indiegogo.com to register as a VIP and get access to our VIP forum!www.gamesandtales.com/forum
 
 
Many thanks to all of our contributors!We will continue the production of the game and everyone who contributed will receive their perks as soon as they become available. You can continue following the development of the game at our forums. Thank you. All Best Wishes,Salvage Team Development Crew,Games and Tales
 
 
 
 

Death Zones are gravitationally bound fields of wrecks and debris, remnants of furious space battles. They are filled with insane shipboard security systems, unexploded warheads and drifting pieces of jagged wreckage. But most importantly, valuable loot and unexpected treasures. That is where the Salvage Teams come in.

We are four grizzled game developers, hailing from the frozen ice planet of Finland. We navigate the perilous reaches of board game development in our rusty Deep Space Office Games&Tales. We have set our sensors to a board game project identified as Salvage Team, but we cannot bring you all the hard-earned fun alone. That is where this campaign and the Salvage Support Network come in.

Our purpose here in the IndieGoGo star system is to gather funds to execute our development plan for Salvage Team, and bring the exciting board game to you during the second half of 2013. You can contribute to this project by purchasing our perks with your earth dollars here in IndieGoGo, by joining the Salvage Support Network to get exclusive inside information on our game development, or by doing both.

To bring the game to the light of day, and the nearest board game shop to you, we need 8,000. This money will go to finalizing our graphical assets, tweaking the game mechanics, printing the games and making sure that our valued employees survive the harsh arctic conditions of our home planet.
Another way to support our expedition into the dark depths of board game design is to spread the word. Inform people in your social networks and cyberspace of our endeavour! Check out our portals at the bottom of the page, where you can direct interested people.
The Salvage Support Network is based in our exclusive cyberstation at gamesandtales.com. Contributors will have access to our discussion forum, where we will share development details.

Salvage Team will have an extremely modular, tile-based board. At the start of the game, a layer of face-down tiles forms the shape of the derelict ship. When the Salvagers delve in, new tiles are drawn face-up on top. The Salvagers will know what types of threats and loot the tiles will contain, but the exact details will only be revealed when the players stay put and face the dangers...

These images are work in progress, the final product might look different, most probably absolutely stunning.
Each character will have a large-sized card with a gorgeous illustration and a character advancement tile. You can build your team from generic, run of the mill Savvies, or big and expensive unique individuals and everything in between. With training tokens and special equipment you can tackle even more dangerous wrecks and bigger loot.

Since modularity and options are priceless artifacts, the Salvage Team experience will be widely customisable. You can play a single wreck in about an half an hour, or an ongoing campaign for the greatest profit and fame.

 

 

Should the campaign reach 10,000, we can add 2 unique, special characters from the Dreams of Altaine novels into the game! These high-salary loose cannons will change the balance of power... for good or for worse!
If we can reach 12,000, we can add Large Tiles to the game! Large Tiles are 2-by-1 special tiles, which contain even more valuable rewards and deadly threats. Since everyone knows what the tiles contain, the race will just get more furious.
And should the campaign hit 18,000, we will include an Event Deck into Salvage Team, bringing even more variety! With still-active defense cannons firing and random power fluctuations breathing life into the wreck, the Savvies will have to adapt or die.
We like co-operative board games, and for 30,000 we can promise you an expansion pack! Which will add rules for a story-based co-operative campaign, co-operative scenarios and heaps of components.
For 50,000 we can create Salvage Team Mobile, a smartphone and tablet computer app, which will enhance the board game experience! It will feature an augmented reality camera to bring the tiles into 3d, a digital Event Deck and an online stock market for the loot, among other things!
80,000 will be enough for us to upgrade Salvage Team Mobile with Grinder, a single-player game where you control the Furnace Shuttle! See if you can do better as a Rodent pilot than the basic AI! Procedural content and camera integration will make it possible to explore the same wreck both digitally and on the kitchen table!
If the stars align and we reach 500,000, we will realize our nostalgic hopes and create Salvage Team – The Digital Game! Fans of such old-school gems like UFO – Enemy Unknown and Space Hulk will undoubtedly be overjoyed of our endeavour!

story:
The game

You are Aria, a small forest sprite, searching for your kidnapped mother. As you progress through the game, you will talk to NPCs, run erands, solve puzzles and obtain new abilities such as swimming, flying and walking on walls. Make your way across a variety of vast worlds and destroy the malevolent beasties that inhabit them. And face the ultimate challenge with some epic boss battles. 

Thank you for taking an interest in this little game. Glade is a platformer for PC, Mac, and iOS, with iCade support and achievements. At some later point, it may be available on Android too. If I could sum up my hopes for this game in one word, it would be 'quality'. I want it to ooze style and sophistication, I want the controls to be smooth and perfect, and the story to be engaging. The UI will be slick and intuitive, the special effects will be plentiful. Already there are little touches like forest flotsam, dust clouds and godrays. It's the attention to detail that I love and respect when I play games, and I always try to inject that into my own games too.

 

 

Background

It all started about a year ago, when I left my full time research position to concentrate on game development. I had an idea for a game: a wonderfully stylish, monochromatic platforming adventure with sparse splashes of vibrant colour and silky smooth gameplay. I just love the atmosphere and moody visuals of Limbo (can you tell?). Also, I often look back on my teenage years of playing adventure games like Dizzy, Metroid and Zelda with very fond memories. Ah, great days!
 
I was able to make a good start on the game, but since then I have had to concentrate on other things, such as raising two kids and paying a mortgage. You know, life and all that. But all the while I was thinking of this game and wishing for an opportunity, not just to finish it, but to really do it justice and make it shine.

I am the programmer and artist for all my games, but I need funds for other things, such as an amazingly moody sound track, level designs, legal/business fees, a fantastic website and trailer to really show it off, and the all important advertising/marketing.
 
 

 

Help us

Becoming a backer of this game will earn my undying gratitiude. Not enough? Well there are also many other perks, starting with luscious desktop wallpapers, through being credited in the game, having your own secret avatar easter egg, and all the way up to receiving that complete source code package for the game.

And if you're feeling really philanthropic, you can become the sole producer of the game to really make it your baby. You will be able to have a lot of input into the game's direction. If this project is sucessful, it will allow me to hire a couple of people and really start fulfilling my dream of owning a small studio. I have worked hard to create a sophisticated codebase for making cutting edge games, but without dedicated artists, designers and junior programmers ... well, there's only so much one man can do.

If you like the look of this game and are unable to contribute financially, then why not help by simply mentioning it in passing to friends, on forums or on your favourite social network. Spreading the word in any way will do wonders for the success of this project, and for that, I will be forever grateful.

story:
Summary

www.YourGamerCards.net is popular and growing.  With the addition of v3 we are gaining more and more users.  We also can now bring you even more features including many things you have asked for.  There is only one problem, our servers.  We are already spending a ton of money each month to rent servers.  Unfortunately it costs too much to upgrade what we are renting so we are going to buy servers that will suit our needs.  This campaign is to help offset the high upfront costs and make sure YGC can continue to grow and server the Playstation community.

What We Need

The funds raised from this campaign will go to funding the purchase of new servers and covering any additional costs like software licensing, taxes, bandwidth, advertising, and anything else we run into.

Currently our database server if in dire need of more RAM.  To rent any more would be a waste of money.  Instead most of the funds is going to a new database server with tons of RAM.  We also need better, faster hard drives to make the cards update more frequently (we already update the fastest but we want them to go even faster), and to handle more users efficiently.  More RAM and better hard drives will also help us to bring out new friend comparison features we have developed.  We also would need a new webserver at this point so that we aren't renting one server and renting space for the other server somewhere else.  In the end this will also make our monthly upkeep cost lower dramatically.  This will help us keep our site free for everyone.  I took over the site with the goal of never requiring a subscription and I intend to keep it that way.

Other than the hardware costs we also have software costs.  When converting to v3 we wanted to be legit so we made sure our IPB and other site licensing was up to date.  Things like chat, forums, guides and other parts of the site were developed by others and require licensing fees.  

Lastly we have rent and bandwidth expenses.  With the hardware update we plan to be self sustaining but we will fall short from month to month.  Any remaining funds will be put toward these costs.

I took over this site and community not to make money but to keep it running indefinitely.  I make no money here and this is not a business to me.  For me YGC is for all lovers of Playstation gaming.  All staff volunteer our time and talents to better the community for all.

The Rewards

Some of you really just want to help out.  Others need incentives.  Personally I like rewards too.  We've tried to come up with rewards that make sense with the donation levels.  Please ask any questions or voice concerns.  Otherwise pick a level you want and help support the cause.  If you wish to donate and give the reward as a gift to another user of the site we can do that as well.  We will send out surveys to handle all rewards at the end of this campaign.

Thank you for your support and let's make YGC even better!

story:
The year is 485 B.C. (Beaver Century), no one knows what year it is to human years. All the beavers want is this one simple, yet complicated thing... To rule the universe.

This can only be done by collecting most of the power crystals of Zendar (that's how beavers call them, I don't know why).

Are you going to help the beavers rule the universe??? ...Are you???


The game is physics based. You have rocks that you can place anywhere you want in the level (YES! even in the air) and swings that you use to cut stuff to enable mechanisms etc... I 'm hoping to desing 30 to 50 levels.zz



I always wanted to make a game, my game, my own, my... precious! I was reading and learning about game development since I was little but I never did something professionally. Up till now!!! I took me one month or so to make the mechanics and some levels of the game... I have put a lot of time into it and I 'm going to do the same till it's finished!!!
At first I thought I m going to make this game for mobile devices something like an endless runner but as development progressed i changed my mind and I 'm going to make a full game out of it, with cutscenes, narration etc... 
I 'm not very experienced at developing games as this is my first project, but i don't think that I 'm going to run at any challenge that has to do with programming or designing, the only thing that troubles me is level design. I hope to design around 30 to 50 levels I have done some and have too many ideas, but i worry if my ideas are not enough for 30 to 50 levels... If not I will ask for your help!! or the help of beavers(they are really good at level designing)
Through you I m going to shelter myself, buy some software i need for publishing the game and eat... I need that to survive as well...
And through me, you will learn more beaver stuff!!!
 





              

             The Actual T-Shirt... 
    Warning!!! It's kind of feminine...


...I 'm not in any way, shape or form sexist etc, the beaver chick jokes are just a cheap smurfs rip-off!! 

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Eigentlich machen wir Filme, Dokus und Videoclips. Seit wir aber im letzten Jahr KUBB oder Wikingerschach gespielt haben, ist uns der Gedanke gekommen, dass es viel zu wenige von diesen Outdoor-Spielen gibt. Und so entstand langsam aber sicher eine neues Spiel, welches wir GOL getauft haben. Passend zur Fußball-WM in Brasilien und einen hoffentlich heißen Sommer, kann man GOL in Parks, Freibädern und auf allen ebenen Flächen spielen. Jeder Spieler bekommt 5 Klötze, die er seiner Taktik folgend aufstellt, um sein Tor zu schützen und gute Angriffspositionen zu haben. Das Spielfeld misst 4 X 8 Meter und ein Mini-Fußball ist die Waffe für den Sieg! Es gilt die Abwehr des Gegners auseinander zu nehmen oder direkt das Tor umzuschießen. Abwehrspieler dürfen nur einzeln fallen, es ist also Präzision beim Schießen gefragt. Alle Regeln gibts mit dem fertigen Spiel geliefert.

Was wir brauchen & Was man bekommt

Um am 12. Juni zum Start der WM in Brasilien GOL auf den Markt zu bringen, brauchen wir eure Unterstützung - und ihr habt selbst was davon!

  • Mit etwa 1.000 Euro können wir starten unser Spiel zu produzieren. Wir sägen Holzklötze auf Länge, bemalen sie mit den Nationalfarben von WM-Teams und stellen so das komplette GOL Spiel (Ball, Eckfahnen, 2 X 5er Teams, Spielanleitung, 2 Tore) zusammen.
  • Für eine Spende ab 50 Euro, bekommt ihr ein Spiel nach Hause!
  • Wir hoffen, dass GOL sich mit eurer Hilfe als Outdoor-Spiel etablieren kann!

Die Auswirkung

Unser Ziel ist es den Leuten, die im Sommer gerne in Parks, Freibädern etc. chillen, ein Spiel zu bauen, dass große Unterhaltung bietet. Eure Spende ist euer Gewinn!

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Solltet ihr selber nicht so für die genannten Faktoren schwärmen, kennt ihr doch bestimmt andere, die genau das tun und bereit sind uns zu unterstützen!

story:
9/5/14: Update Contests begins! 

Lets start a contest!!! It will start today 9/5/14 and end on Thursday 9/26/14 at 11:59 pm Eastern Standard time. The contributor who raises the most money via referrals will get a $5 amazon gift card for every $2k raised by the end of the contest. There will only be 1 winner. Every Friday until the contest ends I will post who is in the lead and how much they have raised so everyone knows. See the Gallery for the current graph. So lets get to sharing!!!

What is My Life Book? 

Well its easier to just tell you what a member said when we asked them what they thought of the service we provide: "My Life Book is Facebook, Myspace, YouTube, Angie's list, Career builder, Kickstarter/Indiegogo, Wordpress and Ebay all in one place! Without the privacy issues and no Advertisements." 

We created My Life Book because we were tired of the advertisements, the selling of our information, the constant begging from our friends to help them with their games. We have had enough. So we went out and created our own. We use it so we would never do anything with your information we wouldn't do with our own. We like our privacy! 

That is really who we are. Here are a couple of videos that will show how we are different from all the others out there. 


We do have a small subscription fee to user our services. Since we do not gain any advertising revenue or sell your information we do have to pay the bills somehow. Here is our current subscription plans. 


We are raising funds to put games on our social media site. We are tired of all the back end crap that the social media games program in. we are tired of begging our friends to help us so we can keep playing, or throwing tons of money into the game. Not to mention the data mining, psychological profiling that is built in to almost all the social media games out there. 

Our plan is to build our own games minus all that crap. Host them on our servers and our social media site. No information will be transferred to anyone about anything you do. You won't need to post and beg your friends to help. Games will be 100% fully functional. 

There will be a price to play. Games will be located in a special section so as to not bother members who don't play games. To access this section you will have to spend activity points. You can get activity points by posting content on the page such as status message, blogs, auction items, doing your own crowd funding campaign, posts RSS feeds, Uploading pictures, videos and music. Everything you do on MLB will give you points. 

Now let say you are just a gamer and don't do a lot of that. You can buy activity points as well. So it will be up to you if you work for it or if you just buy the points. 

The following are the games we going to get rolling on and the estimated costs to build and get them installed and the time frame. 

1. Just a simple pick three maybe use household pets like dogs, cats, birds, etc. maybe some  exotic animals as well. – 6 weeks - $17k - Can you imagine playing a candy crush style game with animals and none of the crap? 

2. Solitaire game - 3 weeks - $8,500

3. Farmville style game where you just do chores and gain money and stuff. – 3 months (15 weeks) - $42,000

4. Chess 2 player . – 10 weeks  $28,000

5. Scrabble 2 to 4 players – 5 weeks - $14,000

6. cross words puzzle – 2 weeks - $5,600

7. Side scroll zombie shoot up – 15 weeks - $42,000

8. Battle ship 2 player – 4 weeks -  $11,000

9. A pet game where you get dragons,  hatch them and do things to make them grow up and can trade them – 6 weeks - $17,000

10. Pacman style game – old school graphics – 2 weeks - $5,600

11. Flappy Bird clone: Underwater version of flappy bird, where you are a shark and you go around eating things and avoiding stuff like dolphins. – 2 weeks - $5,600

That is our general plan. The more money we raise beyond our goal the more games we can create. This is just the start. 

There aren't a lot of risk or challenges to this project. My Life Book is there and running smoothly. It has over 10K users.  We just need to add some games. We have a gaming company that is going to design, program and install all the games listed above.
story_txt: 9/5/14: Update Contests begins! Lets start a contest!!! It will start today 9/5/14 and end on Thursday 9/26/14 at 11:59 pm Eastern Standard time. The contributor who raises the most money via referrals will get a $5 amazon gift card for every $2k raised by the end of the contest. There will only be 1 winner. Every Friday until the contest ends I will post who is in the lead and how much they have raised so everyone knows. See the Gallery for the current graph. So lets get to sharing!!!What is My Life Book? Well its easier to just tell you what a member said when we asked them what they thought of the service we provide: "My Life Book is Facebook, Myspace, YouTube, Angie's list, Career builder, Kickstarter/Indiegogo, Wordpress and Ebay all in one place! Without the privacy issues and no Advertisements." We created My Life Book because we were tired of the advertisements, the selling of our information, the constant begging from our friends to help them with their games. We have had enough. So we went out and created our own. We use it so we would never do anything with your information we wouldn't do with our own. We like our privacy! That is really who we are. Here are a couple of videos that will show how we are different from all the others out there. We do have a small subscription fee to user our services. Since we do not gain any advertising revenue or sell your information we do have to pay the bills somehow. Here is our current subscription plans. We are raising funds to put games on our social media site. We are tired of all the back end crap that the social media games program in. we are tired of begging our friends to help us so we can keep playing, or throwing tons of money into the game. Not to mention the data mining, psychological profiling that is built in to almost all the social media games out there. Our plan is to build our own games minus all that crap. Host them on our servers and our social media site. No information will be transferred to anyone about anything you do. You won't need to post and beg your friends to help. Games will be 100% fully functional. There will be a price to play. Games will be located in a special section so as to not bother members who don't play games. To access this section you will have to spend activity points. You can get activity points by posting content on the page such as status message, blogs, auction items, doing your own crowd funding campaign, posts RSS feeds, Uploading pictures, videos and music. Everything you do on MLB will give you points. Now let say you are just a gamer and don't do a lot of that. You can buy activity points as well. So it will be up to you if you work for it or if you just buy the points. The following are the games we going to get rolling on and the estimated costs to build and get them installed and the time frame. 1. Just a simple pick three maybe use household pets like dogs, cats, birds, etc. maybe some  exotic animals as well. – 6 weeks - $17k - Can you imagine playing a candy crush style game with animals and none of the crap? 2. Solitaire game - 3 weeks - $8,5003. Farmville style game where you just do chores and gain money and stuff. – 3 months (15 weeks) - $42,0004. Chess 2 player . – 10 weeks  $28,0005. Scrabble 2 to 4 players – 5 weeks - $14,0006. cross words puzzle – 2 weeks - $5,6007. Side scroll zombie shoot up – 15 weeks - $42,0008. Battle ship 2 player – 4 weeks -  $11,0009. A pet game where you get dragons,  hatch them and do things to make them grow up and can trade them – 6 weeks - $17,00010. Pacman style game – old school graphics – 2 weeks - $5,60011. Flappy Bird clone: Underwater version of flappy bird, where you are a shark and you go around eating things and avoiding stuff like dolphins. – 2 weeks - $5,600That is our general plan. The more money we raise beyond our goal the more games we can create. This is just the start. There aren't a lot of risk or challenges to this project. My Life Book is there and running smoothly. It has over 10K users.  We just need to add some games. We have a gaming company that is going to design, program and install all the games listed above.

story:
I'm Brandon Todd, a personal trainer and one of the shortest dunkers in the world! I own and operate Flytright.com and am an industry leader in the growing online fitness initiative. Most recently my Inspirational Documentary was voted "Vimeo Staff Pick" after generating 40k views in 48 hours: : http://vimeo.com/74061236

I currently offer online personal training for athlete's and the normal fitness novice. I've received a lot of media attention recently:

Yahoo.com:

http://www.thepostgame.com/blog/eye-performance...

http://www.thepostgame.com/blog/eye-performance...

I've also been featured and interviewed by the Washington Post: http://articles.washingtonpost.com/2013-04-02/l...

You can look at my bio on: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brandon_Todd or my personal website: http://www.brandontodd.tv/

Most importantly, I have produced a top selling iphone fitness app : https://itunes.apple.com/app/flytright/id561882...

However, my fitness app is geared towards individuals over the age of 20 who are pretty serious about their fitness. Through my online fitness initiative I have discovered that younger kids don't know a lot about healthy lifestyle choices! They learn more bad habits from bad role models than they do in health class!

I want to create a mobile game that kids can play that will also teach them about a healthy lifestyle! In the game that I have designed, kids will create an avatar that wants to achieve healthy goals like running marathons, lifting heavy weight, or even playing professional sports! The avatar can mirror what kids want to look like when they are healthy adults. The avatar will send notifications to the kids'

devices reminding them to "get more reps" or "take more steps" or "eat more protein"

While some kids may actually mirror their avatar and commit to a healthier lifestyle, I also intend the application to teach all users about the benefits of being healthy: showing the cons of steroids, the importance of balanced eating, etc.

In a lot of ways, I intend this game to be a "get healthy" version of the Kardashian avatar game where a sense of humor and goofiness are used to reinforce healthy habits for children.

I am looking for $15,000 so that I can develop the software for the application as well as market it to kids and to health programs at schools that may like to use the application to reinforce their teaching.

story:
The Game

By the year 2030, 6 out of 10 humans will live in cities. The way our cities evolve to manage their energy and waste will determine the fate of the planet. Deep City  asks the question, ‘What if cities could save the world?’

If you are passionate about the earth, this is a powerful way to extend your personal influence by driving cultural change through entertainment. We invite you to back this campaign to create a quirky game for grown-ups. It's a mash-up of An Inconvenient Truth, systems thinking, urbanism and resilience.

 

Some of our media coverage:

 

 

 

 

 

The Goal

The goal in Deep City is to survive and build a livable city, using whatever tactics you choose. It’s in your power to create a city that reigns supreme in the face of hostile competitors, a greedy Overlord, and cataclysmic world events. Be the leader of your own futuristic empire in Deep City!

It's about having some fun while inventing possible futures.

 

The Who and the Why

The Team

We're a group of gamers, designers and storytellers who love games and entertainment as much as we care about city life.

 

The Big Picture

As you've probably guessed, for us this is more than a game. Those who play Deep City  will make choices that lead to alternate futures – not on some made-up sci-fi planet, but on our own.

We believe our game will spark imaginations and debate about the kind of future we want, and how to get there.

It might just be transformative.

 

 

 

 

Where You Come In

And that’s why we’ve been working for two years without funding to create storyboards and develop game mechanics.

The Rewards

At any level that you choose to contribute you'll receive all kinds of great 'perk' rewards—advance access to the game (of course!). So if you love strategy games and/or you love cities and/or you are intrigued by the ideas we've expressed so far... we invite you to make a contribution.

Get Deep City 2030 (All Pledges)

All backers will will receive the game before anyone else and will have the opportunity to shape the game through our forum. 

Beta Access: Those who pledge $50 or more will be invited to play a Beta version of the game at least 2 month's before the official release of Deep City 2030. 

Alpha Access: Pledge $700 or more and you will receive an Alpha prototype of the game eight months before release. 

Forum Badges (Pledge $10+)

All backers will receive exclusive access to our private Deep City 2030 Discussion Forum. You'll have the power to shape the world of the future, influence gameplay, and interact with the development team. Backers who pledge $10 or more will receive a digital Deep City 2030 badge that can be used in the game forum, on your website, portfolio page or printed as a physical reminder of your commitment to shaping the future. Each reward tier comes with it's own exclusive badge.

News From The Apocalypse (Pledge $5+)

Stay one step ahead of the apocalypse with quarterly updates on news, technology, and bizarre internet culture that inspires our team.

Credit Tiers (Pledge $10+)

All backers who pledge $10 or more will receive credit right alongside the makers of the game! The position of your name will be based on your pledge level.

  • Tier 1 Overlord (Pledge $5,000 +) - 1st line of credits underneath the Producers & Development Leads. Plus a 140 character bio, a link to your website, or preferred social media site.
  • Tier 2 Luminary (Pledge $1,200 +) - 2nd line of credits underneath the Programmers. Plus a link to your website or preferred social media site.
  • Tier 3 Protector (Pledge $300 +) - 3rd line of credits underneath the Artists.
  • Tier 4 World Shaper (Pledge $50 +) - 4th line of credits underneath the Game Designers.
  • Tier 5 Survivor (Pledge $10 +) - 5th line of credits underneath the Game Testers.

 

Digital Wallpaper (Pledge $10+)

 

 

Get an exclusive digital wallpaper pack for your devices featuring original game artwork from Deep City 2030.

Sticker Pack (Pledge $25+)

 

 

 

All backers who pledge $25 or more will receive an official Deep City 2030 Lazer Cat membership sticker pack that you can place on your beverage cup or any surface of your choosing.

Deep Dive Collector Pack (Pledge $200)

 

 

 

Urban Warrior Shopping Bag (Pledge $100)

 

 

 

Get your very own Urban Warrior eco-friendly tote bag to help stave off the apocalypse.

 

Design a Character (Pledge $300)

 

 

 

If you choose the Character Designer Edition, you get to design one non-player controlled character (NPC). You provide the team with a name, photo of yourself (or a friend), along with a short character description. Our team will place your character into Deep City 2030.

(The copyright to the character name and background you provide will be held by Kolody Inc., which reserves the right to reject inappropriate, anachronistic, or vulgar content.)

Deep City Builder Trophy Brick (Pledge $1,200+)

 

 

 

 

 

For the first five contributors over $1,200, we have a rare and precious brick from the kilns that built Toronto, courtesy of the Evergreen CityWorks.

 

 

 

Your brick will be inscribed with your name and the title, 'Deep City Builder' along with a description of this remarkable piece of North American urban heritage.

 

Design A Buff or Debuff (Pledge $1,200)

 

 

 

 

If you choose the World Maker Package, you will help to create an in-game item used to either attack neighbouring cities or repair your own. You provide the team with a short description of the item, along with an equally cunning name. The team will use your diabolical concept to create a Buff or Debuff soon to be feared by players all over the world. 

(The copyright to the Buff or Debuff you provide will be held by Kolody Inc., which reserves the right to reject inappropriate, anachronistic, or vulgar content.)

 

Become an Advisor (Pledge $2,500)

 

 

As a Game Architect, you will contribute to an early Deep City 2030 design meeting either at Kolody’s Toronto studio or via Skype or Google Hangouts! We'll prep you with background info and you'll participate in the brainstorming, problem solving, wise-cracking and lunch! (Transportation and lodging not provided). 

To show our gratitude we’ll name a city structure after you.

Your contribution will be evermore inscribed in the "Luminary" section of the Deep City 2030 credits. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We want everyone to know about the game. Please help us get the word out and make some noise.
  • It's easy, and it might just bring something new to the world of games and the future of cities. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Several years ago I began to focus intensively on computers and everything associated with it. I found out, that I like PC and because I'm very creative and imaginative person, so I alone created my first websites without prior knowledge in this field, which are now at the level of "huge" game portal www.jwkk.biz with private server. The website is quite favourite and often visited.
People say about me, that I'm "crazy" in this direction, but I want to prove that can do much more.

Nowadays a lot of people love playing games on mobile devices!
Therefore, my thoughts led me to the next big step: establish the company JwkkBiz. Start cooperation with the mobile device game developer and start to develop my games for mobile devices.
However, I don't have enough finances for these intentions and so I've decided to try the possibilities here on indiegogo.
Here I can introduce my project and if you like it, then with your support I can realize my plan to create my game (games) for mobile devices Android (later for other platforms: iPhone, windows Mobile, Blackberry etc.).

Web game based on the popular characters from the TV series The Simpsons™.
Rather than detailed description of how the game looks and works, you can take a look and play the game on the official page : http://hrejsi.jwkk.biz/tiles-of-the-simpsons .
Or you can watch the game play video.

About 464,000 results = Worldwide spread

With your potential interest to support this project, you will allow us to get better chances to succeed in this project and to continue with next games.
We need strong enough computers and other devices for game (games) development and testing, so we can guarantee perfect quality, usability and error free game play. Only then we can guarantee good game experiences in all games.
The more resources, the more platforms we can expand to, and in future not just this game, but also my other games.
All in all, you will us help to expand possibilities and personnel = more possibilities.

Probably the greatest risk is that the game might not be favourite on mobile devices, even though I doubt it, but they say "Nothing is impossible!".
I had small and large problems with the web and it wasn't just handful (for example, from technical difficulties website wasn't working for almost a month). Nothing ever discouraged me from my intentions therefore I never gave up and always solved everything. Hence if complications arise (and they will) we will deal with them to everyone's happiness. Unfortunately, we cannot foresee what kinds of problems we will find while making these games, but we will proudly face and solve everything. Wish us luck and success.

If we manage to reach the goal of financing?
Game development will be better, easier and above all faster.

If we reach only partial finance goal ?
The acquired resources will go on equipment according to the collected amount. We will provide full disclosure on how we spend the acquired resources.

What if we don't reach even minimal amount ?
Of course, we will continue development same as before: very slowly and with great difficulties, according to our limited options.

What if I have question which wasn't explained !
We will gladly answer any question about our project and campaign here on Indiegogo. U can contact us at indiegogoinfo@jwkk.biz .

Can I help even if I can't make contribution ?
Yes. U can use the share option (referral up and down) of our campaign, so as many people as possible will find out about our project.

story:
Hello, I'm Robin and I make Games!


I started making games three years ago and since then I've just wanted to create more interesting and complex games all the time.

Everything I know about making games I've taught myself.

I like math, coding and just about anything related to technology. I wouldn't say that I'm a pro at coding, but I'm constantly learning new things and having a lot of fun while doing it.

Why Am I Doing This ?


The main reason why I'm doing the whole crowd funding thing is because I need some financial help to place my game on Steam Greenlight. It's my dream to see my games on Steam one day, and since I'm still a student I don't have the money to invest in that.

The reason I'm making games is because I simply love making games. It all started when I got interested in how games actually work. Things turned really interesting for me in the coding part, because I feel like that's what brings games to life.

Funding


The money I'm hoping to get from Indiegogo will go towards moving Sweetime to Steam Greenlight. Any excess will help in releasing my games on mobile platforms and support my development in general.

THE GAME 


Right, the game! SweeTime is a speedrunning game where you have to get from point A to point B as fast as possible. Some levels are a lot more challenging and confusing than others, but half the fun is discovering your own route to the finish!

Multiplayer mode is awesome fun! You compete with your friends on who finds the fastest route to the finish zone. Hopefully you will still have friends after the goal is reached!

There are currently 18 unique and awesome levels and I'm making more whilst the game progresses. Can you beat them faster than others and be the ultimate speedrunner?

Be careful though, this game is really addicting! My friends and valued testers that have played the beta are hopelessly addicted, they just keep pushing themselves into harder jumps and better times.

Is it worth it?


Hell yeah! The game is super fun and competitive, come and help me make it shine!

Can you beat them faster than others and be the ultimate speedrunner?Be careful though, this game is really addicting! My friends and valued testers that have played the beta are hopelessly addicted, they just keep pushing themselves into harder jumps and better times.Is it worth it?Hell yeah! The game is super fun and competitive, come and help me make it shine!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, me and my brother are mobile app developers, but also have an interest in trolling the wealth of unfathomably stupid conspiracy theorist like the food babe and health ranger, now we're trying to go the next level with the ultimate form of satire, a mobile game where you are defending your GMO research lab from the army of fraud babe, you will use defenses like gmo corn cannons, chemtrail area effect weapons, and Glu-10 mines to protect your lab from tinfoil hat wearing zombies, amber bracelet shaman and brainless straw-men, and a plethora of celebrity activist boss fights!

What We Need & What You Get

To get this project off the ground we need to reach at least $75, after that we will do the work for free to get the game out on android, the money after that will go to Developing the game on iOS and improving the quality of the project! the more that gets donated the higher quality the game will be.


UPDATE: We have received the funds to start production of Fight the FBA!, and have purchased the nessasary programs to complete the android and facebook versions of the game, further donations will lead to an iOs version and greater expansions and updates!

    .

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

      we are doing this for fun and for fellow critical thinkers and intellectuals that like to have a little fun and enjoy satire, so we are taking all input about ideas for the game, like what weapons they would like to see and what enemies they want to fight.

      check out our website to leave comments. http://inukami726.wix.com/gianthammergames#!Fight-the-FBA/cz8g/9D5F6BA2-D5D4-46F0-8E4C-42DB74C36E3C

story:
Summary

Aren't you bored of all the one minute games for IPhone and Android? Why does your smart phone CPU have 4 Cores if you can't put them to good use? Well, I want to change that! For almost a year I have been working on "Pocket Crusades", and now I need your help to finish this game!

With your help this beautiful real time fantasy strategy game will be released for IOS and Android.



What the game is about

Years after the last fight for "Ria Masa", the former human capitol which was completely destroyed during the battle, Orcs and Humans alike gained strength and will to rule the world of  "Asir'el" alone once and for all again. What started with a few incidents has become another big war which won't end until the sea turns red. 

Choose your side and lead your race into battle, to win the war and claim the land your own.


Humans


The Basic Human troops are quick, however, their strength can't be compared to a trained Orc. Human Hero's are focused on quick, heavy attacks that can end a battle with a single hit.


Even though they don't stand a chance against an Orc in a fight one against one, their building skills give them an edge. The human buildings are all about defense. Taking any of them down can take a long time.

Orcs

The Basic Orcish troops, the Archer and the Warrior, are specialized on breaking bones. Their attacks are extremly dangerous, albeit almost everyone can run from them. The Hero's on the other hand are specialists in long distance attacks, except the "Tank" (1st from right), who is exactly what he sounds like. Extremly strong, with heavy defense.

The Orcish buildings are nothing against human ones regarding defense. However, they can be build extremly quick.


Features

  • Two 8 level long campaigns  (Single player)
  • PvP multiplayer
  • Astonishing graphics for mobile platforms
  • 2 races to choose from (Orc and Human)
  • 6 heros (3 Orcs, 3 Human)
  • Leaderbords and archievements
  • Weapon upgrades, spells and much more!


The first level:


A short presentation on the first level. Pardon my english. Also, note that this video is already a few weeks old, and does not represent the current state of the game anymore. Most bugs you will find in there have been fixed and some graphics and models replaced or enhanced.


What I need...

Besides working on this project and being a student, I have been working part time the last years as a Programmer, so I managed to pay for most assets my own. However, I won't be able to pay for everything, especially licences, since they can be pretty expensive (See below). 
In addition, I don't think I can keep working for a company and working on this project while finishing my degree, so I hope I can raise enough money to focus on this game. Some costs involve:

  •   4500 $ Unity Licenses (Unity Pro, Android Pro, IOS Pro)
  •   3500 $ SmartFox 2x Unlimited User License
  • ~2000 $ Assets that are needed to complete the game


... and what you get

A wonderful strategy game, optimized to be played on mobile devices. Easy to learn, dozens of tactics, spells, events and secrets. It's cute, funny, beautifully animated and gives you joy for hundreds of hours.


    Risks

    I have put more money than I could afford, and more time that I have into this game for the last 10 months. The biggest risk for this project does of course involve money, as I won't be able to pay for the upcoming costs all by myself. If this project does not get funded it's unlikely that I will be able to finish this game, at least not with the quality I'm trying to archieve.

    Perks

    3 $ - I'll tweet you a little message to show my appreciation! (Or mail you if you don't have twitter)

    10 $ - You'll get the game 2 weeks before everyone else does. Take advantage of it, and you might show up in the "Top Players" ranking.

    30 $ - Of course you'll get the game 2 weeks earlier too, but not only that. You'll get 100 Diamonds in the game, to unlock all the heros right at the start.

    100 $ - Your name will be listed in the game credits, show it to your friends and tell them that you made this thing possible! + Everything before!

    250 $ - Get the PocketCrusades Minispeaker, and enjoy the games music and sound in the best quality + everything before!


    500 $  - Wow! You'll get a phone or tablet case for the device of your choice! (Examples below)

    1000 $ - You are unbelievable! Of course you will get a case for the device of your choice. But not only that! Do you want to be in the game? You could think of an easter egg, I'd love to implement it! Or one of the figures in the game could have your voice, if you're not too shy! Just ask me, I'm sure we'll figure something out!


    5000 $ - What can I say, that's amazing! If you happen to be a developer, I'd love to give you the complete source code and all the asset's that I made myself! Of course only after I released the game.



    Other ways to help

    Visit the development blog
    •  PocketCrusades.blogspot.co.at or
    • indiedb.com/games/pocketcrusades  
    and leave some input there, I'm happy about every message I get!

    F.A.Q.

    The last days I received some questions and concerns, so let me try to clear some things up:
    Q: "Your lack of experience is concerning"
    A: I've been working as a Programmer for a big Company (AVL Group) for several years. I've been developing with Unity for over 3 years now, and have used several other engines before. I've graduated from the higher technical school of Kaindorf, and started programming when I was 11 years old. All in all, I don't see that I lack any experience.

    Q: "The budget is too low. I assume that means you will be working on it solo for half a year to a year?"
    A: Exactly. But, the budget is only meant to finance the final part of the development. Most assets, and all the previous development is on me.


    About the Developer

    I am Alexander Stacher, a 23 year old student from Graz, Austria. Besides attending University I have been working as a programmer for the AVL Group for the last years. 

    Ever since I have been a kid I've been developing games. It all started with RPG Maker (good times), and brought me here. 

    After working with Unity for severall years, and almost a year of developing Pocket Crusades, I'm willing to take it one step further, and fully focus on game development.

story:
Short Summary

My name is CPL Damon Williams.  I am an active duty soldier in the Guard and I serve the people of the United States.  Whether it be natural or man-made disasters, lost or injured children, or just helping you launch your kite at the Kite Festival, I am there for you.   I respond in your time of need. 

When not deployed or training, I am an electrical engineer that designs electronics for sporting and medical equipment.  I've developed and brought to market hundreds of products in my lifetime and will continue to better the world with the products I create.

During my time in the Guard, I have constantly been frustrated by my inability to know exactly where my soldiers are.  Whether in a training scenario or actually deployed to a disaster, I only know where a soldiers is if he/she can tell me where they are over the radio (and they get lost a lot...).  And with the recent death of a soldier during land navigation training, I decided to create a system that would never allow a soldier to become lost again.  Not only would we always know where they are, but if they get into trouble, help would be only a push of a button away.  And when help is needed, their exact GPS location can be sent to a Med-Evac to allow faster than normal response. 

The system is already created and implimented.  It works perfectly.  I'm already selling to Paintball teams and outdoorsmen.  Now I need your help to get it into the hands of those that need it the most FOR FREE.  That's right, 100% of this funding will go toward supplying as many firefighters, search and rescue, soldiers, disaster responders or any other Local, State, or Federal support agency with these systems.    And not at retail price, not as wholesale price, but at actual cost.  They will be supplied with as many tracking nodes, base stations, software, and phone apps as they need.  ALL FOR FREE!!  If you or someone you know has ever been in need, please consider contributing...  Please help us protect and ensure the safety of our men and women in the field when they need us the most.

 

 Check out a recent field use (man-portable base station antenna array):

What We Need & What You Get

As stated earlier, these are on the market and in the field.  Unfortunately state and federal budgets have been reduced and reduced over the years and many of these organizations simply don't have the funds to allocate the purchase of these.  So I decided to create this project to ask for help in supplying these tracking system FREE of charge to all that need them...

Every $100 donated to the Track Our Heroes Project will supply ONE tracking node for a responder/soldier/fireman.  I will supply all base station hardware and software out of my own pocket.  If we reach our goal, that's 400 men and women that will have their locations know while in the field and I will supply 40 base station hardware and software packages.  (10 tracking nodes and one base station and software).  And realize these tracking nodes cost $100 to manufacture.  So every dime you donate goes toward supplying nodes.  None of that "admin cost" garbage!!

As for you generous people, other than knowing you are helping the men and women that help those in need, you can receive either a Cert of Appreciation, Gratitude Plaque, or Bronze Resin Gratitude Plaque.  We already have an agreement from plaque marker to donate as many plaques as we need.  So no money for plaques will come out of donated funds..  As well as weekly updates to whom has received the nodes and pictures of them being used in the field.  Imagine if another Katrina hits and every one of our responders can be accounted for at any time.  And if they find someone in need, thier exact location is known.  Even if the power is out and the cell towers are down, we'll still know where they are.

If we don't reach our goal, that's OK.  We will still supply as many tracking nodes as we can with whatever we get.  Even if I only get a couple hundred bucks, that's a couple responders we can help protect...  and if I exceed my goal, then I will supply as many systems to as many local, state and federal agencies that need them until the money is gone. 

 

The System:

The POINTS (Personal Outdoor Intelligent-Networked Tracking System) node is a personal, non-cellular, GPS tracking transceiver that will transmit your location, Emergency status, or give an audible indication to you from Base.  The POINTS node has been designed for outdoor activities ranging from civilian sports events, search and rescue, wide area damage assessment, and even training/deployment of military personnel.  With up-to-the-minute location reporting you will always know where your people are.

The POINTS node is the smallest, lightest real-time tracking node avail on the market.  And by using self-healing, sleep supported mesh networking; each node can also act as repeater gaining maximum range at minimal power consumption.  And without the need for external support systems, like cellular or satellite, there are NO MONTHLY FEEs and will work anywhere on the planet that GPS is avail.

POINTS nodes also have integrated Bluetooth to allow communication with Android smart phones running our POINTS Radar app.  This app allows for individuals in the field to “see” where other nodes are located as quickly as they update.  This can be instrumental in quickly finding lost/injured searches, coordinating team play, or conformation of movements.

 

 

 

POINTS Node Features

 

No fees – EVER

Since our system uses public frequencies, there are no fees (and no license required).  Plus even if you are in a location with no power, no service, or even no inhabitants, you will be able to locate and track all your nodes

Lightest GPS Node on the market

At 3.0oz, the POINTS node is, hands down, the lightest node avail.  And by using standard AAA batteries, you will never have to worry about not being able to find replacement batteries.

Smallest non-cellular Node

The POINTS Node was designed to also be small.  It easily fits in a shirt packet or the shoulder pocket of an Army ACU.  Plus with its industrial Velcro, it can be attached to any surface, including helmets and vehicles

Simple to use

For the most part, the POINTS Node is plug and play.  No setup is needed.  Just insert the batteries and place in your pocket.  The Base Station software will take care of the rest.

Long Range

Because we use a self-healing, sleeping mesh network, each of our nodes can act as a repeater.  This allows for a node's location to “hop” from one node to another until it reaches the base station.  Greater battery life and higher reliability means safety for the user.

Online or Offline

Our Base Station software supports both online system (using Google Maps) and offline system (using a pre-downloaded satellite image or a Crayon drawing for you SEALs).

Military Grid support

Once calibrated (about 30 seconds) the Base Station software can give you the exact military grid coordinate of any node on the map (fixed location online or pre-downloaded maps only).

Battery Life

Holy Cow!!  You never thought 2 standard AAA batteries could last so long.  But with low power transceivers, a sleeping mesh network, and ultra-low power electronics, you can go WEEKS without having to change batteries.

Multiple Networks

With up to 8 networks supported, you can have multiple teams operating in the same location and each have its own independent Network.  Great for Sports activities (paintball) where you don’t want the other team to know where you are

Emergency/Indicator

Each node is equipped with an Emergency button that reports the node's location back to the base station and all Bluetooth active nodes.  And each node is equipped with an auditory beeper that can be activated by the base station to signal the node.  There is also an option to activate the beepers on ALL Nodes on a network at the same time.

Development Kits Avail

For all of you that enjoy writing your own code, we support Developers with both our open source Base Station Software and our Open source hardware.  Although our hardware is protected by Copyright/Patent laws.

Bluetooth (POINTS Radar)

With our Smartphone app, each node wearer has the ability to know where all other nodes are located at a glance.

 

 

Applications

Outdoor  Sports:    Paintball, Airsoft and other outdoor sports activities have numerous players in the field.  This system would allow you know exactly where you buddies are.  Even Equip referees with nodes on a separate network to identify if any refs are grouping together…  Plus hunters are able to know exactly where their hunting buddies are; preventing accidents.

Search and rescue: While searching for lost or injured individuals, a command post must know where all of their searchers are.  And with the Emergency button on each node, if a searcher gets lost or hurt, they can call for help at any time.

Military/Police:      Training can be dangerous.  Especially during land navigation or wide area training.   Make sure you know exactly where your soldiers are to keep them safe and track their path to see how they can improve.

 

 

General Node Specs

  • Size 
    • 1/2wv Ant - 2.5”(L) x 1.1”(T) x 6.2”(H
    • 1/4wv Ant - 2.5”(L) x 1.1”(T) x 4.2”(H)
  • Weight – 3.0 oz (with batteries)
  • Battery Type – 2 x AAA batteries
  • Antenna – RPSMA
  • Independent networks avail – 8
  • Freq
    • Network 0 – 902.400MHz
    • Network 1 – 902.600MHz
    • .........
    • Network 7 – 903.800MHz
  • TX Power – 250mW
  • Range:  
    • Rural – 24miles (high gain ant)
    • Urban – 4miles (0.75mil per hop)
  • Max repeater hops - 7
  • Encryption – 128bit AES avail
  • LED status indicator:         
    • Waiting
    • Searching for GPS Lock
    • Transmitting Location
    • Emergency mode activated
  • Panic/Emergency button
  • Audible Indicator (call back/return to base)
  • Individual Node Serial numbers
  • Industrial Velcro for external mounting
  • Easily fits in Army ACU shoulder/LBE pocket
  • Battery life (standard Alkaline: Locate Rate - Battery life)
    • 30sec - 36 hrs
    • 90 sec (default) - 96 hrs
    • 10 min - 14 days
    • 2 hours - 3 months

Base Station specs

  • Supports up to 250 Nodes
  • USB Interface (VCP – 115200 Baud)
  • Mapping options:               
    • Live, Online Google maps
    • Pre-downloaded image
  • Update Rate: 30 – 7200 sec
  • Encryption: 128bit AES
  • Antenna distance from base station:            
    • USB direct – 10 ft
    • POE - 250 f
    • Local power – 4000ft
  • On-screen Military Grid support
  • ETA to next update
  • Displays current battery level for each POINTS Node
  • Network Modes
    • Node to Base
    • Node to ALL
  • See screen shot below:
   
   
   
   
   

Bluetooth Supported Smartphone App

 

 

Base Station Online Map

 

 

Base Station Offline (pre-downloaded map)

 

Mesh Network Diagram

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, that's OK.  Please forward to any and all you think can help us to reach our goal..
 
Thank you!!
