story:
It’s no secret. We’re broke. Local governments, state governments, the U.S. Federal Government and many international governments are all facing budget shortfalls, spending cuts and reduced services. All of us -- ordinary citizens, elected officials, civic and community leaders -- know that we must make dramatic changes and tough choices to solve this crisis. But how do we engage our communities in identifying and prioritizing the best possible solutions? How do we create more engaged and informed citizens?

Our Answer?  Fix Broke(n) Governments through Serious Games

On January 29, 2011, The Innovation Games® Company designed and produced an in-person serious game to help more than 100 citizens, community leaders and city officials in San Jose, CA collaboratively prioritize possible cuts to the city budget.

Instead of polling residents individually, our specially designed Innovation Game®, the San Jose Budget Games, created an opportunity for ordinary citizens to negotiate with one another, listen to their neighbors and create budgets that reflected not only their own but others viewpoints. Civic leaders left the San Jose Budget Games with both a clear and actionable list of the proposals citizens could compromise on and also a record of why they had found common ground—and the game results have impacted the actual city budget. 

Our experience with the city of San Jose has convinced us that games are a powerful tool for civic engagement: Thus we’re seeking funds to extend our existing in-person version of Budget Games into an online version.  Instead of engaging hundreds of citizens, we want to powerfully connect tens of thousands or even millions of motivated citizens with their elected officials—and we need your help to get this done.

Democrat, Republican, or Libertarian?

We think asking people about their political affiliation before engaging in real discourse about complex topics is not helping us develop the solutions that we need to solve problems. Decades of research in cognitive psychology and organizational behavior have shown us that the optimal group size for collaborative problem solving is between 5 and 8 people. So, we've optimized our in-person and online games for that number. And guess what? When you have a small number of people playing our games, they don't hardly ever ask if their fellow players are Democrats or Republicans or Libertarians or whatever other political party they might fancy. Instead, they work together as citizens. And citizenry is more important than political party.

We also want to stress that we're not trying to change the structure of our government. We believe in representational democracy. What we seek is increased civic engagement.

What We Need to Bring Budget Games To Your Community!

We at Innovation Games have already committed many resources to Budget Games. We have assembled a team of developers who are ready and waiting to help us put Budget Games online and hired a summer intern who has already started working on our outreach program.  We have also trained more than 400 facilitators in cities across the U.S. and around the world, and attracted that interest of several major corporations willing to provide hosting and analytic services to help cities hosting games take action against the results.

While we have built a solid foundation, we need your help to bring Budget Games to the next level!  Here is how your funds will be spent: 

  1. Building an online version of Budget Games produced for San Jose. We'll extend our current virtual market game, Buy a Feature Online to accommodate Government’s special needs, like allowing people to bid on both funding and cutting budget items and restricting enrollment to a set geographic area (i.e. city limits). Note that this approach reduces a tremendous amount of risk. We're not starting from scratch! 
  2. Playing Budget Games in more communities.  We will recruit enough people to play 3,000 to 5,000 online budget games (since each game is based on roughly 8 people, that's somewhere between 24,000 to 40,000 citizens of a major U.S. city). Three cities that have expressed interest in participating in this project, including San Jose, CA, Lafayette, LA, and Portland, OR.
  3. Making you a part of the development process!  The most important goal of the Budget Games is to create a more engaged civil society and so we will keep our IndieGoGo community updated with regular postings, videos of new Budget Games, videos and blog posts of other civic games, and we'll respond to your feedback as we progress.  

What Happens if We Raise More Than $25K! 

Any funds raised in excess of $25,000 will be used to further “gamify” Budget Games to promote extended civic engagement. For example, the creation of a "citizen leaderboard", made up of "citizen levels" to allow citizens who play multiple games to "level up" and play games of "increasing difficulty" with other players.

Other cool ideas we have for your money are: 

  • Make coordination of game facilitators much easier when managing extremely large numbers of players and games.
  • Provide our Innovation Games® training for free or at cost to civic and community leaders; we want to help you change your community for the better.
  • Provide enhanced facilities to manage and protect identity so that citizens can explore very sensitive topics.
  • Internationalize the Budget Games (Buy a Feature), so that citizens around the world can use our online virtual market games to tackle similar issues in their communities.
  • Integrate our system into Facebook to make it easier to play games to promote civic engagement.

Can’t Fund us?  No Problem. Here Are Other Ways You Can Help

  • Reach out to your civic leaders.  We are always looking to bring the Budget Games to more communities, so if you think your city, state or community group would be interested, let us know! 
  • Tell us you want to play. Please let us know if you want to play our games. We're going to be need lots of people testing our ideas and providing feedback on our user interface.
  • Play our games.  Our visual collaboration games are always available for civic leaders and the wider community to use. And you can try playing these games for free on our website.
  • Spread the word.  Let your friends, family, relatives, civic leaders, first-grade teacher, dog-groomer, or anyone else important to you and your community know about our Budget Games project.  Our efforts to build a more engaged, healthy and informed communities start here. Tweet, blog, post to your Facebook wall!
  • Send us your ideas and feedback.  Our games are all about collaboration so we love nothing more than to hear what our followers and supporters are thinking -- things you found interesting, ways you think we could improve and applications you see for our work.  Every idea will help us make Budget Games that much better. 

Closing: Our Pitch in 60 Seconds or Less 

Why Are You Doing This?

  • Participation in government is declining and that’s not good.
  • Elected officials need to understand our preferences so that they can make the tough choices necessary to resolve our budget crises.
  • Citizens need to work together. Our games promote thoughtful engagement over simplistic adherence to a party.
  • The hard problems we’re facing can only be solved through engaged dialog and debate.

Ultimately, a lack of broad participation means that we simply won’t realize the benefits of a representational democracy: Too small of a set of citizens will wield a disproportionate influence over the political process.

Why Should I Get Involved? 

We believe that Innovation Games and other serious games can help solve the problem of citizen engagement. Our experiences with the San Jose, CA, City Budget Games confirm this idea. And taking this online will enable massive engagement. 

Finally and most importantly games are fun!  When was the last time you had a chance to change the world and have a heck of a good time doing it? E.B. White would be proud of your donation!

Want Even More Information on Innovation Games® and Civic Engagement? 

Check out our the Innovation Games® website for our collection of in-person and online games and more information on the private sectors businesses like Qualcomm, Reed Elsevier, Cisco, Vendavo, Armstrong Flooring and Emerson Climate Technologies that have used our games collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to solve a variety of complex problems. 

For more information on the work we have done over the years to support many nonprofit and government agencies see: 

  • The San Jose, CA, Budget Games:  Take a look at our game design here, the results of the games, and how we envision Innovation Games can be used to to help nonprofits and governments in the future.   
  • Attack Poverty Project with Grameen America and PDMA : In this video, Katherine Rosenberg of Grameen America gives us her initial impressions of the Attack Poverty games.
  • Pro-Bono Work by our Globally Trained Network of Facilitators:  Over the years, we've helped churches and other faith-based communities, the Agile Alliance, the Scrum Alliance, the Agile Product Leadership Network and the Project Management Institute, to name a few.

We have a proven record of using serious games to solve complex problems. Our unique approach is such that the same game design can be used with both in-person and online populations. But we need your help to bring these tools to the global community.

story:
HETZCHASE_NAILWAY

::: Fund to start early development!

If you're interested in seeing a stand-alone release of Hetzchase Nailway built in Unreal Engine 4 for PC / MAC / LINUX / Xbox One / PS4 then this is the place for you!

Early Test Footage Built In Source SDK:


If it succeeds then a demo video will be assembled and used for promotion, showing to publishers, requesting additional funding, and beyond! If it fails then another concept will be chosen, promoted, and built upon.

Professor Ian Boswell is a Game Designer from Jacksonville Florida.
He has been making games since 2005. His modification, released in 2007 won a lot of acclaim. It can be downloaded and played here: 

http://www.moddb.com/mods/hetzchase-nailway

Full Playthrough Here:


FIRST_PERSON_SYNESTHETIC_PUZZLER

The new release of Hetzchase_Nailway will be all about the music, the ambiance, the atmopshere, and the combination of puzzle-based and visual elements together to create a cacophony of sights and sounds not seen since the government recall of all the Polybius machines!


STEAM_GREENLIGHT_VETERAN


Ian B. has already gotten one game through greenlight which didn't succeed in its initial crowdfunding campaign. He is willing to go the distance and do it again for Hetzchase if necessary as it is a pivotal part of the Hundred_Earths Universe- A series of games, blogs, videos, and short stories which connect together to form a whole picture of a unique world existing inside of Ian's head.

The last game Ian managed to release on Steam was Rush Bros. 
Trailer for Rush Bros. available here:
Ideally Hetzchase_Nailway will have a publisher, however, and will not need to go through Greenlight in order to get on Steam. Or perhaps by the time it is completed (in roughly 6 months assuming this fund is secured and additional funds can be obtained) it will be able to release in a big way with a lot of action and attraction!

Stay tuned to our news section for more exciting announcements and updates!

story:
Hi, we are the TF2 Punchline team, or at least we used to be. Actually, Punchline decided that even after a lot of won french lan parties, they won’t support TF2 anymore due to more popular/mainstream games getting priority supportwise. Sad thing ...

We were expecting to find another organisation but unfortunately no one was able to pull anything worthy due to the short time table until the event (we started looking in June though), or just not being interested by TF2.

Also, due to most of us being/mercing in prem last season, we were not allowed to attend the I49 Online Tournament for a chance to earn free tickets.

So without any support whatsoever, we’re in from our own pocket by roughly €1600 to cover lan entry fees, travel and accommodations. The €600 goal covers entry fees and allows us, if reached to pay less fees to Indiegogo. Anything over €600 will help with mostly gas and with magic bus rental fees.

 

Team roster

- Tek36  and Captainhax as soldiers

- Flippy and Plapla as scouts

- kustom3 as medic

- Exon as demoman

 

We are also bringing with us the all mighty T-Mac from team Infused, and another french TF2 player Paria!

The cherry on the cake is that we are also bringing with us the famous french caster from the french version of VanillaTV, aka Pognon. He will be covering the full event, so french people stay tuned for the cast!

Also, he's the amazing singer from the video above, props to him for this masterpiece!

 

Where are the donations going ?

Donations received will mainly cover the cost of the lan entry fees, accommodations and transportation.

 

What are the extra bonuses ?

If you want a signed weapon, feel free to ask any player from the team, even if you can’t donate!

We will be streaming some POV of players during the lan event - don’t know who’s going to stream yet (it should be either Tek36, Flippy, or maybe both!) so you guys can enjoy the hype of this event at home!

story:
Salve and hello!

My name is Alex Richmond and I’m the lead designer at ZAMA Game Design. While I love creating and designing (and of course, playing) board games, I’m also a high school history teacher in upstate New York.

For the last several years, I’ve been working to create games and historical simulations that are fun, engaging, and have a strong educational value. I’ve designed countless games for my students and my classes, but now I’ve begun to create games that I hope to share with a much greater audience.

And that’s what Swords and Heroes is all about.

Swords and Heroes is my first attempt at designing a game with a broader audience in mind. It’s a two-player tactical board game, based on some of history’s greatest classical civilizations.

In Swords and Heroes, players will be able to choose their civilization, build their army, and then lead that army into battle. Gameplay can be severely altered by the actions of your general, and each culture carries with it a variety of different advantages based on the history of those people.

The rules are simple and easy-to-learn, but the experience is complicated and diverse enough to keep even the most seasoned gamers interested.

The problem with many of the games that are similar to Swords and Heroes is the overall cost. Similar tactical table-top games are made incredibly expensive by intricate miniatures or are burdened by overly-complicated rules. We’re hoping to produce a game that’s simple and easy-to-learn, but is – more importantly – cheap and accessible.

We want to create something with the convenience of a card game but with the complexity of a full-scale tabletop game.

Thus far, we’ve been working with a great print-on-demand company, but in order to drive costs down to retail values, we need to print our product on a larger scale. This is certainly a major and expensive undertaking, and we’re going to need help – your help.

We’re looking for eager participants to help generate the money that we need to make this happen. While we plan on first releasing our “STARTER SET,” we’d like to consider adding expansion packs that offer new, additional armies to compete with. We’ve got big goals for Swords and Heroes, but as it’s said, every journey begins with a single step.

We’re looking to raise $20,000 to print and distribute our product outright. We’ve already begun small-scale distribution, but we’d like to further expand our market and drive our cost down considerably. To do this, we’ll need a good chunk of change, and we hope that you’ll join us in raising it.

The vast majority of the money goes directly to the printing costs associated with creating the game. Whenever you’re producing an item like this, cost for the consumer will always drop based on the publisher’s quantity. This method isn’t cheap for the publisher, but it’s the most effective way. Additional funds will go toward our marketing and distribution. We’ve already been promoting the game through local game stores and online venues, and we’d like to see this continue to grow.

In our initial prototyping of the game, we partnered with the incredibly talented Benlin Alexander, who designed the beautiful artwork you see on our box-top and many of our promotional items. The final piece of the funds we hope to raise will go to Benlin so that he can make Swords and Heroes look even more amazing – not only the box but what’s within it as well.

$20,000 is a lofty goal, and we realize that. In the event that we don't reach this mark, that money will still be collected and will still go towards developing Swords and Heroes -- albeit on a smaller scale. We'll continue to use the services of our print-on-demand company and use the money from this campaign to drive down retail prices as far as we can.

In addition to our undying appreciation, there’s plenty that we’d like to offer you as a ‘thank-you’ for your support. Most donations over $50 will earn you one of the pre-release copies of the game itself but we’re also looking to give away some of our eye-catching posters and awesome t-shirts (sporting the insignia of either the Romans or the Germanic Tribes… your choice!).

Best of all, this fundraising campaign is one of the few places where you’ll be able to get a hold of our limited edition expansion pack: THE WARRIORS OF SPARTA! This is a rare opportunity to take control of the battlefield with some of the most legendary warriors in all of history. This expansion will never hit stores and will never be available online, but we’re going to offer it up to you as a thank-you for our generous support of our campaign.

In the event that we’re able to exceed our goal amount, we’ll begin pushing for our stretch goals.

For each $5000 we achieve beyond our initial goal, we’ll publish and release a new and exciting expansion pack. Each expansion pack will add an additional army to add to your arsenal, giving you a new style of play and new tactics to field. While our original starter set will include the ROMAN EMPIRE and the TRIBES OF GERMANIA, future expansions will add in additional cultures that existed during the classical era.

Which civilizations will we see? Well that’s up to you…

Pledges of any amount will earn you VOTES toward making this decision.

Below, you’ll see a list of possible civilizations that we’d love to someday add to the Swords and Heroes experience. In the event that we achieve our first stretch goal, we’ll ask you – our contributors – to cast your votes and decide on who will be the next great Swords and Heroes civilization. Contributors will be able to vote through the comments section of our Indiegogo page. We’ll start this vote long before our stretch goal.

Even if we don’t hit any of our goals, this vote will help us to determine what you as the community would like to see.

After you pledge any amount, simply send a quick e-mail to ZAMAVotes@gmail.com with both your name and what civilization you'd like to offer your votes to (you're more than welcome to split multiple votes!). At each stretch goal milestone, we'll take the top-ranking civilization and get to work!

Current Totals (as of 5/3/13):

  • Han Dynasty of China [10 VOTES]
  • Carthaginian Empire [7 VOTES]
  • Macedonian Empire [5 VOTES]
  • The Kingdom of Kush [5 VOTES]
  • Parthian Empire of Persia [0 VOTES]
  • Gupta Empire of India [0 VOTES]
  • Hunnic Empire [0 VOTES]
  • The Mayan People [0 VOTES]

story:
My Dayz Server - Bambi Sanctuary is a BRAND NEW server that is looking for people who enjoy high vehicle spawn maps, 24/7 day, and auto-refill!

Like I said this is a brand new server! This server is all about having some competitive fun with others and enjoy the game of dayz! The server has 500+ vehicles and 20+ helicopters! I always try to listen to the people who join my server so if any suggestions are given I always try to look into them and see if there is a viable option!

If you are at this web page because you would like to donate to the server, i want you to know how awesome you are. Obviously you will recieve perks based off of how much $ you pay! Im still working on what you get for each level of $ you pay, so any suggestions will be more then welcomed!

All the money that is given will either go straight back into the server or given to admins. Due to this any money that is given wont be refundable unless you send me a msg and we can work something out due to the fact that the money will most likely be spent instantly.. lol.

I hope everyone has an awesome time on the server!

 

Keep in mind, while rage is going to happen, please try to keep it to a minimum! Would be much appreciated and would save a lot of work for the admins!

Send ALL donations for the server to my paypal cwilliamson159@yahoo.com
